reviewText:
This is among the best games I've had the pleasure of playing, hands down.

It's a shame this game doesn't get the attention it deserves. There's a small, yet loyal following that genuinely wants this game to be the best it can be. Even though it's a voxel-based FPS, it far exceeds your run-of-the-mill CoD or BF in many aspects. It's the simplicity of Blockstorm that makes it beautiful.

What's great about this game is amount of customization available through the in-game editor. You can create your own knife skins, guns, mechas, player models, and can even forge your own maps with ease. Because of this, there's a ton of free community-created content via the Workshop. You don't have to sell your house, car, and your left testicle for a knife skin like you would in CS:GO. Just subscribe to an item in the Workshop, and you're good to go.

There is one main criticism I would give this game: The ping. If I had a lamborghini for everytime I shot someone in the face without them dying, I would be Tai Lopez. It's not uncommon to see pings above 150. It can be frustrating dying to someone you KNOW you should have killed. This is one of the reasons why this game may never be competitively viable. However, you'll learn to shrug it off and keep playing. It's still a blast to play!

For the price of a burger, you just can't beat it. Skip food for a day. Buy this game.

Forget Ace of Spades and Block n Load, this game has so much more to it, it has more than just workshop maps, but MPCs, weapons, tools and characters. the blocks are very well textured and the gameplay is a lot smoother and less laggy and buggy. Hope to see you in a game soon! :)

reviewText:
[Review Version 4 - 20th September 2015]

Note: As a admin of both the Blockstorm Official Forums and Steam Forums, and a moderator of the Official Servers, my opinions may differentiate from the average player.

Blockstorm is an unique, voxel-based battlefield like no other, allowing players to design and construct their own tools and environments, and share them with the community. If I said that Blockstorm was a completely different game to the likes of AoS and Guncraft, I'd be wrong (and highly unoriginal). Instead, Blockstorm takes all the problems from its predecessors and renovates them to create a stunning cubic cosmos for creative wizards and vigorous soldiers to traverse.

Enough of this fancy talk.

Last year, I was browsing Steam for a relatively cheap game that offered something different. Blockstorm came up pretty fast, and I decided to check it out. Chuckling at the possibilities of the in-game character editor, I instantly bought it without hesitation. However, something was missing; the servers were empty, and the game didn't have much replayability. The game seemed quite interesting, so I stuck around for another couple of weeks.

With the release of the infamous Blockstorm demo version (infamous because of how similar to the full game it was), a crowd of unfamiliar faces popped up from all around the world. The servers became more and more active, and so did the community forums. Official Events started to pop up, welcoming even more players into the blocky realm. Blockstorm updates started to become even more common. Alot of demo players upgraded to premium accounts.

Ghostshark Studios, the creators of Blockstorm, are very active throughout the community, regularly popping in for a match or two when they have some free time. They've helped the community grow since the start, making it what it is today. Blockstorm's update speed is very frequent - we usually get an update every month or so. However, the truth is the game is being updated constantly (just not announced), wether its a bunch of bug fixes or small features; last week, we got a few new mapping mechanics allowing players to make some forms of timed circuits to make their maps stand out from the crowd!

When you play Blockstorm, there are two routes you can take (both intwine with each other). If you are strong, valiant, and ready to spill some pixel blood, you can join a server and battle it out to reach the top of the official leaderboards each week (prizes available), level up all the way to 100, or even take part in a tournament! However, if you are more of the creative type, you can access the editors, and build your own characters, weapon skins, turrets, maps, and even the brand-new mechas! All your creations can be shared through the workshop with other players (if you decide). If you are skilled enough, you may even hit the front page so everyone can see your new designs!

Blockstorm itself is very finished - future updates are just christmas presents that are opened too early! At this current moment in time, the community is very active and loyal, Ghostshark are continuing on fixing some issues, and official/unofficial events are weekly!

Blockstorm Features:
- Stunning in-game editors - complete with powerful tools to match any level of skill.
- Addictive, smooth gameplay - perfect for any FPS veteran or noob alike.
- Balanced weapons/vehicles - everything feels just the way you want it to.
- Active, loyal and friendly community - who collaborate together and help each other.
- Dedicated developers - that do their best to make the game perfect for everyone.
- Rapid bug fixes - find a bug? Report it to a developer and they'll get right onto it!
- Cheap, underpriced - would you rather buy that cold, bitter coffee that lasts seconds, or an astonishing game that lasts you years?

This game is perfect for anyone who loves fast-paced, voxel-FPS games, but also likes to sit back and sketch up a new idea with their friends. It has a replayability scale that is so large, that I may never stop playing the game completely.

Welcome to Blockstorm.

~

Join our official group, Blockstorm Active Players to hear frequent event updates, ask for game help, collaborate with other players and much more!

reviewText:
Well well well. This game in short is Ace of Spades revived with a big focus on gameplay along the lines of Counter Strike 1.6 and Half Life 1 Multiplayer. It really is great fun and the graphics kind of give it a charm that makes it feel like it comes straight out of 1998 or something. The block based levels are great, giving you tons of ways to play a match for example literally pumping a 100 bullet mag into a wall just so other people don't have the cover of said wall anymore. Of course you can also place blocks yourself, building small walls to crouch behind when you reload.

Basicly if you like Counter Strike-ish games with a little twist this sure is a game to pick up, especially now when its on sale.

And the editor where you can make maps, skins for your weapons and for your characters is amazing. Easy to use for everyone and so many options to be creative with. I bet this is where most people will spend their time.

reviewText:
[Updated May 22th, 2015]

So this is Blockstorm, a new FPS about blocks and customization. It may look generic, or a shameless rip-off of games like Minecraft or Ace of Spades, perhaps, but seriously, don't be fooled, it is a lot more than you think.

Overall

Blockstorm is a multiplayer only shooter set in a world of blocks, where you build, destroy and customize. As a shooter, it follows the classic rules of an FPS: precision aiming, crouching, jumping, running and noiseless walking, everything you'd find in other shooters out there. However, it relies on player interaction with the map to make matches the more dynamic they can be. This interaction happens in the form of building and destroying.

By using the provided equipment, players are able to tear entire buildings down, create alternative paths, blow up walls, build stairs, reinforce, connect structures, anything you might imagine. It helps making gameplay distinctive and unique, according to what players come up with in-game.

Weapons are pretty much common to any FPS, being them: assault rifle, light machine gun, sniper rifle, handgun, two shotgun types, sub-machine gun and machine pistol, each of them dealing a given amount of damage to players and blocks. Explosives are also available: C4, grenades, claymores and RPG, which are the most fun weapons you have at your disposal. Finally, you have the shovel and the placeable block, which will be the main tools you'll be using to modify and customize the battlefield during game time.

To help map makers create a larger array of maps, NPCs are also available. For now, there are two types: zombies and automated turrets. Zombies have simple spot-and-seek behavior, and can be used in any map kind. Turrets work as defensive structures, and can be used in any game mode. Both of them can be configured with a nice array of settings, like health, movement speed, etc.

It also provides amazing tools for those who like to customize or create their own content. Maps, guns and equipment, NPCs, characters...anything can be created or customized in the blink of an eye and made available in the workshop.

Game Modes

For now, there are six available game modes:
Deathmatch
Universal game mode: kill anyone to score.
Team Deathmatch
Universal game mode: kill enemy team to score for your team.
CTF
Universal game mode: get enemy flag and deliver it to your base to score for your team.
Hunt
Original one: obtain blocktanium atoms from zombies or blocktanium pods and bring them to your base to score.
Castle Battle
Original one: destroy enemy chests and throne to score while defending yours from enemy attacks.
Assault
Original one: a simplified and asymmetric  version of territory domination, where one team must dominate a target, while the other must defend it.

Each of them work quite well so far, and each of them have a nice set of maps available.

Balancing

Weapons are very well balanced, and they will only get overpowered in the hands of an overpowered/skilled player. Before each spawn, you are able to choose your loadout, each gun adds weight to your loadout, and the general rule is that the most damage and destruction power means the slowest run speed and accuracy, so it is almost impossible to rampage around without being exposed to enemy attacks.

Built-in maps are also pretty well balanced, rarely encouraging camping, as it means, most of the time, acting as target practicing, not to mention being quickly dispatched with a C4 from behind a wall.

You can find the best suitable play style for you as long as you get used to the loadout you decide to use, for real, without relying on overpowered damage or movement speed.

So, by the way it is for now, game is well balanced.

Customization

Blockstorm's main and strongest feature. Almost everything can be customized. All editors are based in the same idea, and every content produced with them can be shared (via workshop, or in-game), and locked, if you wish to keep it only to yourself.

Maps
A powerful editor lets you build maps ranging from all degrees of complexity, being you a master architect or just a newbie in the world of map building. Tools are available to speed up building process, such as brushes, default forms, paint tools, selection tools, etc. Map editor allows you to toy with many different settings, such as environment, weapon slots, weapons available while spawing, boundaries, and other variables that can be applied to your map. Another important feature is the ability of creating prefabs, which are useful tools for reuse of something you might want in more than a map.

There's also a terrain generator that helps you create the initial settings of your map, with a decent array of options, such as size, height, type, etc.

Every built-in map is also fully customizable.

Characters

Characters are the skins you wear and determine how will your play model look in-game. Character editor lets you build your own character, by using the same tools available in map editor. For now, you are able to edit each body part separately: head, torso, arms, legs, hands and feet. Arms, legs, hands and feet are mirrored. The way it is right now, it is impossible to implement different body parts for each side, but in fact, it won't never ruin the overall quality of it, neither prevent you from creating a good looking character. Character default skeleton can't be removed, but the limits around it are reasonably good, good enough to make any adaptation, and anything but creativity limitators.

Game comes with a good selection of built-in characters, which are fully customizable, and can be used as models for easy implementation of any other character you might think about.

It uses a different idea from the map editor, using colored blocks instead of textured ones.

Guns

Every gun and piece of equipment present in the game, except for C4, claymores and grenades (and the placeable block, of course), is customizable.

Each customizable gun or equipment works as the starting template for a custom version, and like characters, they have a default skeleton, which can't be removed, and, unlike character editor, some guns are pretty limited in terms of new possibilities and different approaches: for now, we are unnable to create a bullpup assault rifle out of the AK47, or add extended stocks to the Uzi, or add a red dot sight to all of them. However, these limitations are slowly being removed as we give feedback to the developers, so it's something the player base must be concerned about.

Like the character editor, this editor uses colors instead of textures.

NPCs

Turrets have a similar editor to guns and character editors, being based on colored blocks, with also a default, irremovable skeleton. It will let you build each part of it, with decent space.

Zombies can be customized in the same way you would a player character.

Community

Now this is where Blockstorm gets the high ground. Here we have a friendly community, with players that like to discuss and give feedback, and developers which actually listen to what we say, and that's a really big thing.

Yeah, you will find typical examples of trolls, like griefers, chat spammers, swearers and whatever, but every online game in History will be swarming with those, so don't even bother about them.
______________________________________________

That said, my personal verdict: 10/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is pretty fun!

Imagine Ace of Spades, except actually improved upon and not turned into a Call of Duty-like game. It features a variety of weapons and interesting mechanics. I think one of the big sellers of the game is its custom weapon and playerskin makers, as well as map making system. The combat is fairly good, though it has room for improvement. I found that matches tend to be rather... Quiet. It felt somewhat isolated when playing with other players. Hopefully the community grows to circumvent this issue.
The loadout system is very interesting. There's a weight (In KG) system that dictates how fast you move. If it's 6 KG, you move pretty fast. If you weigh 10 KG, you'll be slower.
There's weapons like a rifle, a sniper rifle, an assault rifle, an SMG, a shotgun, and a heavy machine gun. They all tend to synergize well with a certain side-arm. Yes, there's more than just your pistol. You're given the choice between choosing a regular pistol, uzi, and a small shotgun with two shells loaded in. Ontop of that, you can also pick your grenade type. It can be a frag grenade, a C4 that can be detonated on command, a claymore that detonates when a player touches its laser, or a freakin' RPG... With only one rocket.
You can also use a block placing tool and a shovel to manipulate the terrain.

A few issues I have encountered is that the game does NOT autosave your custom skins, maps, characters, etc. This means if you accidentally quit, it's gone. Yes, it happened to me when I was least expecting it. Another issue that I feel like only I get annoyed by is making weapon skins. Whenever you make a weapon skin, there's certain blocks that cannot be broken. This is so that you don't make an SMG look like a shotgun. I tend to get a little annoyed with it, but I can understand why it's there. I would like if there was some system that lets you delete those blocks, but on the offset that only you can see the skin. The only other issue is that the community is small. Hopefully by the end of the two week free-to-play event, the community would had grown by then.

Other than that, it's pretty good. Get it if you liked the original Ace of Spades. Cheers for monthly updates!

reviewText:
So I have been having this game since like, 2014. I have to say. This game is very good

Art it is really good if see what some of the PEOPLE in BLOCKSTORM COMMUNITY HAVE MADE! Spicing it up, add Shadows just like adding the tea leaves in water to make tea just makes it great and nice. Looking being sweet to look at.

The gameplay, it is not FAST PACED so do not LISTEN TO THE REVIEWS that are by Curators. The maps do effect some of the gameplay, but please PLAY this game if love the likes of A. Counterstrike or B. Ace of spades classic. You will have a great time. Yes this a quick review god darn it!

The multiplayer? It kicks potato bags. :) It is very fun, a great ammount of people to hang out with. The servers do not mess up mostly, besides the Asian ones, which if your in Asia, your tentacled. Nobody may not understand what I mean by that.

Level editor, it works what it is supposed to do, be a level editor and not a gimmick. Too bad it can't be a Mr. Gimmick, if was that, I would love that. :) The level editor has prefab support and you can put in customization from turrents, to sandwhich zombies, to well anything that you think of that isn't outside the box, but nether regions. Enough blocks to work with, even though later on give me a rainbow, a big double rainbow tripple sizes with a cream pie.

Does this offer something to the table of voxel fps's? A plate of delicious customization. Guncraft started customization for anything, Blockstorm perfected it. =) It doesn't have allot of signs of said, been here and done that. It takes in what I liked about the ace of spades classic game with the better graphics, and puts it here with extra features and with more fast pace. I really say this is the DEFINATIVE VOXEL FPS or any FPS to OWN!

It has tons of features to work with for you guys who love customizing, curcimizing, and counting how many hours you have been playing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

There is something really special about these block games, cant put my finger on it. I just enjoy them ALOT.. :)

Lets start with the good stuff:
Creating maps with the editor is easy and the editor feels powerfull in the right hands. Multiplayer online is super fun. You can create and share / play with your own created characters.

There is no veichles in this game and i dont really miss them either. Why? The maps created are more like close combat or sniper variations aka old COD UO. The difference is ofcourse the gfx style and that you can destroy almost everything on the maps so never expect to be able to hide for to long. :)

The game is created with the community in mind so start creating some cool or funny maps to share. Fun fun fun...

I would recommend that you buy a 4 pack and share with your friends for some fun gaming. And lets help this community to grow, the game really deserves it.

And sadly a tiny tumbs down:
The characters can feel a bit floaty sometimes. Just jump and you will understand. Also a sprint button for quick getaway would be most welcome.  The run speed used in current game can be walk speed and run could be done in bursts with energy bar.

((Please note the game is still in early process so this can change))

And yes the score:
GFx 9-10 (Usefull comparisons Minecraft, Guncraft, Murder Miners, Blockland)
Sfx 7-10 (its okay and fits the game)
Music 6-10 (Not much to say, but it fits where it is)
Gameplay 9-10 (SuperEasy creating maps and fun)

I will gladly recommend this game because its super fun online. And who does not like blowing stuff to bits or creating your own maps to play with your friends. (( Get it on 25-50% SALE ))

The community is not large but this is where we can improve. BUY and PLAY :)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Blockstorm is a early access Voxel FPS game from Indie Gala.

If I was going to compare it with other games...
It has most similarities with Ace Of Spades and other voxel games,
but gives me the feel of Counter Strike... except for the compeditiveness.

It's a really fun game to play with friends. I bought it today and have had a fun 3hrs on it until now.
Edit: Almost up in 110hrs now, loving it. Even if you got no friends who owns the game, it's loads of fun.

There's different weapons you can choose, every weapon has it's weight, the weight of the guns you use effect your walking speed.

The mechanics is much better than any other voxel FPS I've tried.
Weapons are balanced (no weapon in need of nerf or too nerfed)

Comes with map maker and character creator.

The music in game is also very enjoyable.
Ofc there is bugs, but thats what you get from Early Access.
Edit: Bugs is being fixed shortly after you make devs aware of them.
(Devs are very friendly and helpful & listen to what the community wants)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

EDIT: 30APR2015

I am honestly too lazy to write reviews, but this game actually deserves some attention and a larger population.

To begin, I am not a fan of minecraft or any blocky looking games. However, the graphics do not affect the gaming experience whatsoever. Blockstorm feels like a proper FPS game, and the map destruction, and ability to build structures/barriers using blocks provided to all players, result in often unique gameplay every time.

The guns, although a small number, have their own feel and characteristics. Unlike other FPS', Blockstorm is successful at delivering a different combat experience with each weapon. The sniping mechanics were a little difficult to master, but the skill necessary to one-shot kill your enemies is cleverly nerfed with the scope sway.

The maps and game modes seem very appropriate for the price tag, and the map/character editor give you an even bigger bang for your buck.

The player mobility is affected by gear type and weight. This feature encourages the player to think about the weapons and gadgets to carry to be effective in the current combat situation, or to match their playing style.

Blockstorm does have its issues. One of those is the spawn system; the enemy team can overpower your team and spawn kill quite easily. There is a few seconds of invincibility right after spawning, but a skilled spawn killer can ruin your game regardless of this feature.

Overall the game is worth every penny, and a must have indie FPS.

NEW INFO

After giving it some thought I forgot to mention another major issue the game has, and I feel obligated to share this information to avoid encouraging people to make a purchase without this knowledge.

The game, at its current state, does not have a large player population. It can be difficult to get a full server, but most of the time when I have played I actually found one or two servers running with enough players. I do not believe this is an issue with the game itself, but with the lack of popularity. As previously mentioned, the game deserves a larger population.

reviewText:
IntroThis game is a first person shooter made with blocks, and a highly detailed editor that let's you make just about anything you can think of, It's extremely fun and one of the best I've played in a long time, make sure to read this review as every game does have some negatives(Though very little), and at the end of the review I'll send you a link to where you can actually get this game for free, so let's just get straight into the pros and cons

Pros- Gameplay - As I said above it's a traditional first person shooter, with the regular things you would expect to see, and like most of them it all works out really well though it added some new features like the shovel, and a block adder, during any kind of matches you can dig into the environment and build on it, allowing you to build cover or make unique breaches into enemy territory, overall the main gameplay of the game for me is ok, as most of my hours in the game aren't in multiplayer
- Editors - In the game you can use a thing called editors where you can build on or edit any model in the game including weapon skins, characters, mechs, and maps, this feature allows you to make highly detailed creations of nearly anything you want that can be instantly used in gameplay, you can also upload these creations to the workshop and have others use/download your item, by the time this review is out I’d have made about 17+ workshop items for the game, the creation factor is very easy to learn and really fun once you master it, and it’s so fun that almost all of my hours in the game have gone to making things rather than even playing it
- Replay Value – Wither your playing the game for creation or gameplay it seems to have a never ending amount of content to keep you locked in at all times

Cons- Some Balancing Issues – During some multiplayer matches every base for the teams are unique, while this is a cool feature  some teams have a better advantage due to the higher ground/location
- Could Use Some More Editing Features – While the editing is almost perfect there is some more things that it could use such as metallic colors, clear blocks, and a few other things
- Few People In Multiplayer – While I can’t blame the game for this it’s still something that needs to be said, while there still is some there is a pretty low population of Online people so some of the more creative or interesting game modes no one may be playing
- New Weapons – While the game has some there isn’t that much of a variety when it comes to weapons, hopefully some new ones can be added in, in a future game update

Final VerdictThis is a amazing game though it could definitely use some critical updates to make it that much better, overall I’d have to give the game a 8/10, even though I got the game for free if I knew how much I’d enjoy it then I would have even bought so make sure to get this game down below I’ll put a link where you can get the game for free and the second link will be to all of my Workshop items so you can see how free you can create things and so that you can subscribe and rate up all of my item :3, Thank you for your time and I hope you enjoy!!!
https://www.indiegala.com/givmessage?message=ok

reviewText: When I was younger, the original Ace of Spades (non-steam version) was one of my favorite games to play.  Blockstorm is a game that I feel can rightfully be considered the sequel of the original Build and Shoot.  The workshop integration and editor capabilities allow for some interesting skins and player models to be used, while the ability to manipulate the terrain and map allows for various engagements.  As for the weapons, they're all pretty self-explanatory, each with their own pros and cons.\n\nOverall, this game is great.  If you have the spare change to pick it up, I'd advise you do so.

reviewText:
After reading the reviews implying this was the follow up of Ace of Spades and Guncraft (GC) I got interested in buying the game since I was a big fan of Guncraft. Oh boy was I fooled.
Not much more alive than GC - except during sales (but that happens in any game) or DEMO servers (which like the name says, it has demo players) - and with gameplay similar or worse than GC I've felt completely tricked by those reviews.
While in GC most people still had the patience to make their own gun just for their own sake/fun, I doubt here anyone will waste time making a full scale playermodel since the developers made like 25 of them. And since it doesn't have gun maker did they compensate with more standard weapons? Nope, I believe it has even less standard guns than in GC himself. Sure it has the basic weapon types (assault rifle, shotgun, sniper rifle, machine gun), but personally the only gun I find effective is the machine gun.
Without mentioning that layout management enforces you to run" (there's no sprinting) overcombered in a game that you "GOTTA GO FAST". Each gun/tool has a certain weight. The heavier you are
date: the slower you "run". This means either you like it or not you'll always have to "run" with things you may not use in the match. But even if you did carry a rocket launcher or more combersome weapons
recommended:
would it make a diference? Nope because you'd be running extremely slow.
Also has a map maker that nobody will have enough time to make anything good.
It kinda made me depressed waste 12€ on such game. As if that wasn't enough 2 weeks later the game gets a weekend sale for 5€. In times like this you wish steam would make refunds. (At the time of purchase steam didn't had refunds yet).
If you bought the game
hoursPlayed: hope you enjoy selling your cards. If you haven't but still feel inclined to try it out

reviewText:
Befor I get into anything, I just want to say I have wasted alot of my life on this game, and know its ins and outs. Lets begin.

The game has a skin editor, no it does not effect the gameplay other than a flashy gun.
There are 6 base guns, 3 secondary guns, 4 or 5 explosives, your blocks, and a shovel. I belive thats all.
Each gun has its ups and downs, so I will be reviewing each gun and what needs to be fixed on it. If you think you can stand all the imperfections, you buy the game.

Rifle - The standard semi-auto gun. Though it has amazing accuracy and power, your not gonna hit ANYTHING at long range with the zoom for its aim. It is easy to use, and pretty much perfect.

Shotgun - Weighs WAY less then pretty much every other primary. Spread gaurentees that you hit something within a ten block range, and speed garuntees ( scuse the spelling plz ) that knifes are no use unless its a backstab. Ironically, the shotgun would weigh as much as a rifle, and it would be the person running that makes you so fast... Otherwise this is basically a long range knife, and what your going to be pulling your hair out over.

MP5 - Alittle bit of a nerfed version of the AK. Honestly there is little point in using this gun other than an ( ok ) range for an automatic. It takes somewhere around 15 limbshots, 5 body shots, or something like 3 headshots to bring down a man with this. It is as if a rifle had a nerf d*** and had a baby with the AK. In a more ironic view, the devs think people want .5 less weight as a bribe to use a nerf spewing peice of metal. Personally one of my faves, because the ( ok ) ranged shots. Your a pro if you can use it.

AK-47 - Basically the above - some range reduced and weight added in turn for better damage and maybe fire rate.

M240 - For all the nerf in this game, this p**ses me and many others off. 100/300 for pure ammo, weights something around 8 kgs, a whopping firerate, 4 to limbs and body, 1 to the face. THE MOST OP GUN IN THE GAME. YOU NERFED A SNIPER, MP5, PISTOL, AND RPG, BUT NOT A TANK OF DEATH. Basically, your alittle slow shure, but this gun is accurate to a splinter on a wall 5 miles away. Heavy recoil aswell. I don't even want to talk about it.

SNIPER - Ah yes. My pride. My joy. With no noscope capibility at all, a one second wait for the scope to give the gun sweet acuracy, 1/10 ammo, and overall a COMPLETE PEICE OF NERF. I mean like, really. The only way to get ammo is to pick up bags from fallen allies/enemies. Snipers cannot do so. Why? THEY DON'T WANNA DIE. I mean, no noscopes? fine. Hardly any quickscopes? Getting unbearable. 1/10 Ammo, Complete BS. Reminder, this means you have to reload after every shot, even if you missed. The reload takes about 2.5-3 Seconds, about half the M240's, and is a complete nerfbomb. ( devs plz fix ) Using this, like the MP5, means your GOOD. ( With the exception of abandon, there its the most popular. ) Also, there is a delay on fire, If you fire and die directly after, the game acts like you never shot. you need to wait for the audio of the fire to finish and reload to start, otherwise the shot never happened,

Pistol - Never used by anybody accept a sniper. Horrible even at close range, 5 headshots, 7 bodyshots, I forget how many limbshots. Horrible accuracy. Never use. ( Devs fix plz )

Uzi - Snipers best friend, weighs alot, not worth it, pretty good though.

Shorty 12G - Mini shotgun.

RPG - You need to wait 5 seconds after firing for it to actually fire. Sucks even with direct hits. Don't use.

Thats about it. Have a good day,

Early Access Review

A VERY fun game. It's like Counter-Strike and Minecraft had a baby (or rather, it's like Ace of Spades when it was still good). You can make your own skin literally block by block (and the skins in this game are VERY detailed because of it), you can even edit the turret and zombie skins (yes, there are zombies in the game!) You can even customize your weapons so they look whatever you want them to look like (though there are some minor restrictions in that field, it's still cool). To top it off, it even has a MAP EDITOR, so you can make whatever kind of map you want, build your own prefabs (structures that you can later use as assets for other maps or share), and pick what modes and weapons you want on the map! You could have snipers only, make it run for Team Deathmatch or CTF, etc.

All in all, this game will never leave you bored of creativity, and it's a really solid game (aside from some minor bugs, but again, MINOR bugs). I fully recommend this game to anyone who wants a nice Minecraft-style shooter with good weapons balance, and a wide variety of creative tools at your disposal. (And if you are wanting to scratch that itch that Ace of Spades used to give you before Jagex screwed it up, this is the game you should get).

reviewText:
I am a huge fan of Blockstorm!! I am a 30 year old mother of 5 children, ages ranging 1 yr-12 yrs old, of which 4 of them, and mself, are all pretty active Blockstorm players. Of the 6 of us, my 11 year old and I are both pretty dedicated/serious Blockstormers, playing some varying amount of Blockstorm almost daily.
This is my first experience playing an FPS game on a PC, and the first video game I have played since the 90's!

Some of my favorite things about playing Blockstorm...
-I laugh sooo much when I am in this game. It is competitive if you want it to be, but So.Much.Fun.
-I love seeing all of the creative skins and occassionally I enjoy checking out the maps and weapons and skins in Workshop for a change. There are some very talented content creators playing and creating in Blockstorm!
-I was pretty easily able to make my own skin with no experience doing anything like this before. It was frusturating at first but easy to get the hang of the editor. I'm just, unfortunately, not exactly creative...and my priority seems to be mastering the game play.
-I love the community in this game. The forum is also great if I would remember to use it more. There are some really seemingly great people involved in this game and many friendly, dedicated players. Of course there are TONS of jerks in the mix, but hey, it keeps things interesting and keeps me laughing.
-Love the weekly Blockstorm incentives
-Worth the low price they are asking
-Love the block-world style, like minecraft with pvp, super fun

Things that annoy me about Blockstorm...
-I think it would be great if there were more default maps rotating on the servers. My boyfriend (40till5) has shared some AMAZING maps to workshop that I witnessed him put hours and hours and hours of work into, but as far as I can tell they are basically going to waste. Obviously other people can host them if they are subscribed, but who really wants to play unranked? I guess I can't speak for others, but ranked servers are where I want to be...my bf doesn't play Blockstorm anymore currently, but when he did, he was definitely more dedicated to the creative aspects of this game than myself. I wish I could see his, and other creators' amazing works of art, rotating on a default server all of the time too.
-I am surprised at the lack of updates.
-No voice chat
-Needs more players, or I'm gaming at awkward times? I mostly play around 6-8 a.m., 3-6 p.m., and 12-2 a.m. EDT. Sometimes the servers are packed, other times...zzzzz desolate.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This review is for the early access Blockstorm. Sit down and listen to me carry on and allow me bore you to death. :)

Brief Summary

Don't get me wrong, there are many games out there that allow you to build your own maps out of blocks and then allow you and some friends, or some random people to completely lay waste on your map. Although most of them are unfortunately terrible, sometimes due to pay to win with the free to plays, or some just are out there in Early Access floating around trying to grab your money with a game that is only 20% complete. No, this game is not like this. I can easily say that I had fun with this game with the many shenanigans that have happened to both me and my mates. Despite the lack of servers, as the only official servers that aren't empty are demo servers meaning the player will need to host their premium servers to play their maps with other premium members.

Now I'm going to go back for a moment, and trust me I won't take long. This game is fairly limited content wise, there are very little prefabs, however I have noticed that more and more prefab packs are being released in the workshop, which is very good. The weapons are lacking in numbers and the gameplay mechanics can be refined. Again however this game has only been out for a short while, and in my time from when I bought it, I have noticed quite a few interesting changes and additions such as turret editors, new developer made maps (which I really don't care much for as the buzzing workshop community has made.) I really do see much potential for this little, but as this is only gameplay wise, as again the weapons are lacking, some of the animations can be cleaned up and multiple other implementations would be nice.

I actually urge you to buy this then to play the demo as that means the community grows and the developers get more money to kickstart this game from where it is now to a full complete game in no time.

Pros

- It's fun editing and creating maps... then completely annihilating them with friends.
- The workshop community is always at it creating new refreshing and unique maps.
- This game is fairly good for what it's potential may become.
- It's got some pretty fun maps, despite them being on the demo servers.
- Endless creativity, building tunnels, to making massive defense towers it's almost endless with the map maker.

Cons

- It does need a bit more content, however it is still in very early access.
- Unfortunately this game is overrun with demo users... again I urge you to buy this to support the developers.
- It is fairly basic, some new mechanics would go a long way.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is a cross between Minecraft and Counter-Strike, some games that have tried to mimic this formula have failed but not this title. I bought this game before most of the major updates happened but back then the game was completely playable with only minor bugs, but when we asked for more customizability they delivered firstly with the level editor where great maps and stunning levels were made, then came the skin editor which everyone had used for a level of personalisation that could not be achieved by a map. Then the Npc editor where turrets (only npc availiable at the moment) were mass produced for map makers heaven. My Favourite: the equipment editor wich made this game the must have game for anyone who had a nack for making and testing guns on blocks or players.

I have seen this game evolve through its major cycles but I still don't know what is to come next. I recommend this game to anyone after an awesome casual first person shooter.

If the devs see this I congratulate your guys for making this game and its community perfect for the hardcore and the casual gamer alike.

reviewText:
This game is one of the best games i have ever played, and that's a lot coming from me.
First off, i will say what this game is about, i will try to make this review short.

IF CALL OF DUTY AND MINECRAFT HAD BABY, THIS IS IT

THE GOOD:
-Good graphics
-Guns actually have recoil
-ALL SKINS FOR EVERYTHING YOU WANT ARE FREE TO MAKE OR DOWNLOAD
-The jumping man, it feels like you have an exoskeleton on you, or a jatpack.
-You can blow and destroy anything you want, i recommend C4 if you want to ♥♥♥♥ maps up
-It's pretty well optimized
-Good community, i didn't encounter an ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ yet
-There is gravity so you can blow buildings up and fall
-Maps are really well made
-Really fun
-No hackers

THE BAD:
-Small community, usually only 2 servers are filled but that's okay i guess
-Grenades can hurt teammates, including yourself
-Fast knife attack (yes its exactly like cod) has a bigger range than it should have
-Some maps are a bit too big

What i would change:
-Better animations for when you get kills, now its just a text on your screen
-Able to see your hands on the viewmodel
-Reload animations, now your gun just goes out of the screen but that's fine


If you want a fun game where you can destroy everything and kill everything, dis iz 4 u m8






Oh and there is an achiviment for rage quitting :D

This is my second review of this game, it went from being Recommended to absolutely NOT recommended.
The developers have absolutely no plan for this game.
It went from a game with lots of potential to... Yet another voxel based shooter.

I DO recommend playing the original Ace of Spades (not Jagex's terrible version here on Steam)
Seriously, google it, play it and be blown away by how much better it is than this game.

The only difference this game has with others is that it has block physics"

date:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Blockstorm is a fun game and what makes this game great is its map editor and avatar editor. The editor not only allows you to create a map but you can also create your own prefabs (objects, walls, props etc and add it to your prelab library) but you can download new ones from the community and also share your own creations as well and of course your maps. The map editor is quite powerful, you can easily copy complete objects big or small to duplicate including very large buildings. This makes things like creating roads or wanting to duplicate multiple objects easy.  If you want to cut your teeth on designing good multiplayer maps this is it. There could be some minor tweaks and polish added to the editor to improve its ease of use but its not hard to learn and does the job well.


I'm impressed with how there are no frps drops from some of the detailed and large maps some of the community (some good quality maps there) has made for an older computer like mine.

At the moment there is only 3 game modes but more is to come. For where Blockstorm is now its well worth the money, if you like designing stuff then you probably will spend just as much time in the editor as playing online. The thing this game lacks at the moment is more players. No doubt we will see more weapons and gameplay being added in future updates.
voteText: 9 of 14 people (64%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is a list of things about Blockstorm, I've noted some of the things I've noticed and liked/disliked. Now do understand that everything i've listed, as said by the devs, is subject to change in the game. You can check the date of this review if you find something off.
Pros:
-Nice gunplay, and most of the guns are very nicely balanced.
-Graphics are very good for a voxel-based game.
-Fun to mess around with the ingame character/map editer (You can literally make Elmo if you wanted).
-No lag on official servers
-Good netcode that doesn't cause lag issues
-Freedom of choice (in term's of loadout,looks, ect).
-Very nicely made official maps/ characters.
-Very active and kind devs.

Cons:
-If you lag, it benefits you(I hope for a fix ASAP, or even a ping limit setting whenever you make a match)
-On some maps, it's very easy to block a spawn and camp. (This can definitly be fixed).
-Knife is a bit overpowered imo (I can see backstabs as 1 hit kills). (I've decided this was unecessary)
-Building on the battlefield could use a bit of improving (Have a ghost block, be able to build on a face you can't see, besides this, building is nice).
-Very small community (It really bugs me)
-A bit of tank controls (Would LOVE to see it more tight) (it's been adjusted to be more tight)

What I think could be added to enhance the game:
-Sandbox/lounge gamemode: You can just build and hang out with friends or anyone and show off that awesome skin you just got finished making if you wanted.
-Thirdperson Spectator and/or a Spectator team
-Server modding or modding: Could be used to allow people to create their own gamemodes (ex. RP)
-Custom Weapons (and possibly edit the stats)
-Workshop support (it's been implemented. YAY)

Edit: I've noticed a lot of discussions based around on whether or not this game is different from Ace of Spades, Guncraft, and any other voxel shooter out there. And I, as a reviewer, should set an answer to a potential game loss. This game does stand on it's own in it's own right.

Yes, it takes certain elements from AOS, but don't always think it rips off. Blockstorm was likely inspired by AOS, and it adds onto what AOS had done, though doing it in it's own way.

Yes, the shooting may be a bit generic, but it can be very tactical if you play with the right people. The game was designed to be a bit slow paced, almost like Battlefield.

Anyone who is against this game, whether by similarities with the other voxel shooters, I do hope you give it a chance as it's own title. It's nowhere near as terrible as some have said, but rather good.

And besides, it's in Early Access. It may improve, it may setup or add, it IS changing whether you like it or not, possibly for the better or even worse.

To conclude...
This game is something you could pick up and enjoy on the spot (For me it was). Being able to create your own character in ANY way you wanted to is something that makes this cake shine. I also enjoy making maps, as the editer is very good. And currently with a price tag of $12(It may change), it's cheaper and better than the $15 AOS.

reviewText:

Now, it could be that stuff has changed since I last played; but I doubt it, as irritating playerbases rarely ever die out in games like these.

And yes, the Community IS a part of the game. The game could be legitimatly fun, but a few sour servers could ruin the fun forever.

reviewerDisplayName: ALT+F4 to see my real name
reviewText:
Blockstorm has a lot of unused potential that could have very well been accessed if more time was put into the game, as well as maybe a little bit of a different overall direction. Blockstorm is a blocks-based FPS. Its about as interesting as it sounds. This game tries to do this thing where they combine typical first-person-shooting gameplay with Minecraft-esque building mechanics; which has already been done a few times, but who's to say that Blockstorm can't unlock that potential that all the previous games in this vain haven't unlocked? The game developers. Instead of the refreshing take on this genre that I was hoping for, Blockstorm turned out to be just another typical FPS. The building aspect is very underdeveloped and does not play nearly as large of a role as it should. Breaking and building feel tedious and unessential. This is something Ace of Spades did much better with its building system. Breaking blocks felt extremely satisfying and fun. Building shelters and defense architectectures to take cover from the enemy was also important. You could shape entire pre-made levels into new environments, making each round unique. But here, the building aspect is very shallow and completely unnecessary.

The gamemodes, weapons, classes, etc are also all very limited and narrow. The weapons are poorly balanced and the classes are utterly useless. Classes do not change agility, weapon variety, anything besides your character model. The music is annoying and incredibly incessant, and the community is what you would expect.

There is one thing about Blockstorm that makes it stand out, however. One thing that, if expanded upon, could create a wonderful and bracing first-person-shooter. And that one thing is... the editors. Nearly everything in this game is visually customizable by entering the Editors option in the main menu. You can customize the appearance of weapons, equipment, mechas, turrets, zombies and your character; as well as create your own maps.

Unfortunately, overall, Blockstorm is an easily forgettable experience that wastes lots of potential.

5/10 - Average

reviewText: This is probably one of the best voxel block shooters I've played. It's definitely how I wanted and what AoS should have been. Tons of customization available for both player models and guns, with the only limits being the model bases and your imagination. Great *if a tad repetitive after awhile* music that highly invokes old arena shooters. The battlefield is dynamic and ever changing building crumble bunkers are built craters appear after explosions etc. The guns themselves are quiet nice too, They feel like they have actual power behind them with the recoil system though the same cant really be said for melee as more often than not it feels extremely floaty and leaves me oft wondering if I even hit the enemy at all while my corpse topples to the floor from a silent blow. Hope this game gains more of a playerbase and more updates. Definitely worth 7 dollars. 8/10\n\n

reviewText:
Blockstorm is a great game. This one has a bit of everything that you'd want in a block based shooter. From its fully destructable environments, customization/Steam Workshop, building, various gamemodes, and fast paced gameplay, it makes for a really fun experience! I'm also looking forward to when this game gets more popular with the steam community, and we get more content, becuase as of now I believe this game isn't getting the full credit it deserves for how good it actually is.

Plus its an added bonus if you like Steam achievements because you'll get a bunch right off the start from just casually playing the game. Please pick this one up, it's exellent!

10 - 10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis Game is worth the money. its fun addicting and there is no in game purcheses needed, plus the weapon,skin and map editors are great and simple to use but, they take awhile to master. reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is surprisingly fun to play. I usually hate all these block related games that seem to spin-off the already dreadful Minecraft, but this game is very fun to play. It allows complete customization of all of your own weapons and character, and the blocks actually make it simple enough for anyone to design something. The in game editor is simple to learn, it only took me about an hour to begin making my own stuff.
The gameplay of a shooter is pretty good too. It's a little realistic for a block game. I don't know all the weapons, but they all seem to be based on a real gun. They all work fairly well, even though I was annoyed the sniper rifle shakes while walking. Very realistic.
The game modes are rather interesting, but could use more balancing. The zombies mode is even still PvP and PvE at the same time. I hope a simpler co-op mode is added eventually. But really most of the game modes are all known game modes that anyone uses, it's not very unique. It's still nice though.
I'd recommend it.

reviewText:
Pros:

- Guys, it's 7€, come on!!!
- Refreshing and interesting sandbox shooter concept
- Supports content creating among the community
- Fast action, default maps are well designed
- Skin/Map/Character editor makes for some funny and random moments while playing
-> unlikely to get boring


Cons:

- Movement is not responsive enough
- Mouse aiming results in delay (the mouse drags behind your movement, no possibility to turn off as far as I know)
- Editor is not directly accessible, a bit of a messy interface


There are some cons, which are to be ignored for the review, because they are not related to the quality of the game but I thought I'd mention them anyways, please dont get rejected by them:

- not enough people are playing for a multiplayer shooter
- servers are empty very often, clicking on the quick match" option results in joining an empty server
(so always choose a server instead of doing that)


conclusion:
It is a fun
date: entertaining and refreshing game. Content is constantly flowing into the game
recommended: so there is no repetetive maps or gameplay
hoursPlayed: but the controls are not as responsive as they could be.\nOverall I do recommend this game
voteText: because a larger community will help to improve the game to a point where I have nothing to complain about anymore.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This Game is Truly AMAZING! I have never found a game before that was developed to look pretty simple but was really really fun to play. This game is like a combo of Minecraft, CS:GO, and Call of Duty, Love That. I love the customization that this gamer offers, this is what really keeps the game up and running. This feature gives the ability to let players create whatever they desire and can make TONS of variety skins for the weapons itself. I truly TRULY recomend thi game to everyone out there! Keep up the great work, and hope to see more in the future after Early Access :)

Suggestions:
1) Zombie Mode for Zombies
2) Domination Game Mode
3) Guns Had Interchangable Parts - Gun Attatchments
4) More Creative space for Weapon Editors Skins
5) Multiplayer World Map Editor
6) Enable Reskinning For Claymores, Grenades, and C4
7) More Players Per game
8) Gamemode Similar to Search and Destroy from Call of Duty and CS:GO
9)  More Weapons - Personal Favorites: SMG: PP90M1, Skorpian, AK74U, MP7/ AR's: M4A1, Scar-H/L, M16, FAL, F2000, M-Tar, FAMAS/ Sniper: Dragonav, SVD, Barret 50. Cal, Intervention, EBR/ Shotgun: Spaz, R870 Remington, Double Barrel,  Sawed Off Shotgun, TAC
10) Tacticals should be added to the game such as Flash, Stun, and Smoke grenades
11) Killstreaks
12) Allow Sniper to get Hit-Markers instead of it being one-shot kill no matter where you get shot at
13) Economy for In-Game Weapons (If Possible)
14) Medic Packs
15) Music In-Game Instead of Just Main Menu Music

Thats All Of The Suggestions For Now, Hope you take in consideration on some of these :)

What can I say?  A game that I can build my own FPS levels in a Minecraft-esque setting and host them online, all for under $5!  It's a great deal IMO!!!  It has streamlined building next to MC.  I highly recommend this game to any Minecraft junkies wanting to use weapons to kill your friends with!  Fun FPS game!!!  The game runs great on my computer.  I had no problems building, finding or joining games!  FUN GAME!!!

Here are my system specifications: Apple iMac, i5 Quad-Core Intel processor 3.1GHZ, AMD Radeon HD 6970M with 1GB dedicated video RAM, 4GB system RAM, 1TB hard drive running OS X version 10.6.8, Journaled HFS+ Extended file system.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Incredibly fun in many ways possible. I even created Markiplier in this game! The editors are great for making yourself into the game, or to make characters from other games and stuff into the world of Blockstorm itself. Modes like Deathmatch and Team Deathmatch are so fun it doesn't make me wanna stop.

This game deserves a must-buy, because I love everything about it! So, bring on the blocky soldiers because it's time to 'Storm those Blocks'!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

BlockStorm!.....What can I say I mean, yeah it is better than COD, but your not here for that so heres the good and bad sides:
---------------------------------------------------
The Good:

-Make your own characters block-by-block
-Make your own map block-by-block
-The Gunplay is awesome
-Way better than Guncraft, Equal to AOS

----------------------------------------------------
The Bad:

-Few people play this game (so you should buy BlockStorm and repopulate it)
-Sniper rifle is very hard to aim
-When I do get more than 4 people in a server they most are Italian
----------------------------------------------------
Conclusion:
-The game is really fun I'm not gonna lie, It's just that more people need to play this hidden gem. So people up-vote this comment to get the word out!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A Voxel FPS Shooter game where you can Build you're own custom character and fight people in pretty decently sized maps.

Good things about this game-
1) I have not found any gliches thus far in my time playing
2) The community is pretty good, either people that don't talk or people that like to have a good time
3) Weapons are very equal, shotguns (close range) to the Ak which is medium range
4) I got to make a Starcraft Marine from nothing pretty much toke me over 6 hours it was very fun
5) If you like to create things and not shoot people up, make characters, and create maps for people to play, then host you're own game :)

Like I said this game is pretty fun, The only time its not is when you die alot, which will happen. Everyone has differen't skill sets in this game.

Bad things about this game
1) Its a FPS shooter, like CoD and its like CoD and Minecraft slaped to each other.
2) Building stuff takes along time if you want to make something decent. Voxel by voxel pretty much
3) Communinty like I said is good, but the new 10 year old kids that buy this game spam the chat insaulting people and being immature. -_-
4) RPG's you can not fire on depend you have to wait for like 3 seconds before you can fire.
5) Last but not least, You can fit in 1x1 by 1x2 spaces which is kind of weird considering that my guys is like the scale of a minecraft character and these little voxels are like 1 foot by 1 foot or less hahaha

Other than that this game is pretty fun, hardly any gliches. If you like FPS shooters and don't get mad at them, this game is for you. Building is tedius but is fun, I enjoyed my time creating my characters <---- I make it sound like you need to, but there are deafult characters, and who ever you meet ingame it will put it into a thing to download (in game of course) I hope this helps anyone planing on gettings this, I tryed to give some details about its weak spots and strong points, Enjoy the game :)

reviewText:
The game is fun to start with but dulls down later on through playing it, like all games.

Gameplay The shooting is smooth, but with high recoil which can be tamed once used to, depending on the weapon. Some weapons are more powerful than others, but can be taken out tactically. More skill is needed to play this game, in my opinion. The enviornment is destructable aswell, creating some interesting scenes and gravity does take role.

Customizing Most of my time in this game was in trying to make interesting weapon skins, which didn't upload properly to the workshop. Why? I don't know, but most didn't. Still, you can completely customize the weapon, minus the fact you have a limited workspace and can only remove certaint blocks. These blocks are the inner-gun, which, logically, shouldn't be removed. Characters can also be created, aswell as NPCs and tools. Maps can also be created for this game.

Workshop If you can't seem to get into making your own stuff, or if you just don't feel like your doing well at it, the workshop is always here. Plenty of people upload characters, weapons, tools. NPCs, and more onto the workshop for this game that they have created.

Overall  I would give this game a 85/100 (8.5/10), mainly due to the fact I found the multiplayer to be semi-interesting. The multiplayer was fun here and there, but I kept losing my interest.

reviewText:
Nice game, might sounds like a Ace of Spades ripoff, but at least the devs are still supporting the game with an ongoing community and it's actually pretty good.

In terms of gameplay, there is a good choice of weapon types with weight penalty that make you slower depending of what you're using, knowing that the melee weapon is deadly this make the game experience really balanced. The game modes are fine, going from the usual Deathmatch to some team camp battle with various objectives.
Speaking of specifics game modes, unless if you're planning to do endless deathmatches (even then...), you will need some level designer skills if you want to keep yourself on the winning side. The fact you can build stuff with basic cubes can really change completely any matches, it works as well as defending/reinforcing walls as just distract the enemy. The same goes for piercing the ennemies wall at the right place to make a breaching.

The workshop in addition of the community that grows bigger, offers a lot of content (which are mostly skins and maps), the game come with an editor so you can basically make anything you want with a little time (always check the workshop first, maybe someone already did it first), it's not the best voxel editor I know but it do its job.

The only problem with that game is also one of its strong point: the community (which kind of remind me one of a certain Open Lierox game back when it was popular). Between the servers that play the same map over and over again for no reason, the players that sometimes go full ♥♥♥♥♥♥" (Tropic Thunder reference
date: sorry for the slur) when all you have are the rushers who throws a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of grenades and hopes to hit top board with nothing but lucky shots (protip: rig the map with as much claymores/tripmines as grenades they're throwing
recommended: these guys never watch their steps) and the campers who sits on a high spot and shoots at everything that moves (protip: reply with a good ol' RPG launcher
hoursPlayed: it will blow them AND their camping spot

votesTotal: I personnally think it's ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t but anyways
votesFunny: protip: write their ID if you can followed by "WHAT ARE THOOOOOSE???" in the chat) and the user-created maps that didn't involved level design at all.\n\nThe biggest flaw can be countered with a good team
commentsCount: intelligent playing always prevail over cheap tactics. The issue is: there is no team balancing

column18: so the player have to switch team by themselves (which in fact never happens).\n\nTL;DR: Really good game if you're not afraid of voxels

reviewText:
Im really enjoying this game. Has mode's that I really wanted to see (build mode) and new takes on old modes (Capture the flag for example).

Nothing more fun then digging a tunnel through a mountain to grab a flag under their nose.

The workshop for this game is also great. TONS of skins for everything! Gun skins, player skins, shovel skins... anything and everything, and everything is free.

Finally there are no classes, but you can play very much to you style. I love to run around with a rifle, uzi, and claymore's.

reviewText: Only two downsides: no singleplayer, and no custom weapons, unless you count skins for already existing weapons
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game runs very smooth.  Unlike other modern FPS games, which run poorly on my PC, this game runs well when all graphics and resolutions are at absolute lowest.  Which means turning EVERYTHING low and off.
The gameplay itself is similar to Counter Strike and Warface and many other vs games that include capture the flag, team deathmatch, and storm-like games.  Despite the graphics not looking real (more like minecraft), the game still looks good and the gameplay is smooth and interesting.
One of the things this game may need, in the future, is a single-player campaign.  Like Counter Strike and Warface, which will have a campaign, this game needs one to expand its gameplay.
Like someone else said in their review, there needs to be a way to allow two or more players to collaborate their ideas into one map or gun to lower time spent and to make the map or gun out of two or more different ideas.
The guns in this game need work.  Just because you can customize your weapon, doesn't mean they WORK differently.  There need to be more gun types and accessories added, especially on the sniper rifles.
This is one of the few games that I know of where you can literally destroy the entire map.  With a team of about 10 - 12 compliant players, you COULD destroy the entire map and allow for NO room for spawning.
I recomend this game to anyone who is into regular casual FPS games like minecraft with guns.  The servers can also be reached from different places such as at home, outside in internet providable places, and even at school.  This is important because I used to mainly play this game at school to pass by time.  I give this game 4.5 stars.

reviewText:
I would have to say, I actually like this game. A lot.
Parts of the community are decent, and as long as you can find the right people, you can learn how to play pretty quickly.
Although, one of the only complaints I have about it for now is that the Hunt matches could use more maps. Currently it's only the infested map, and it gets a bit boring after a while to be able to play Hunt on only one map. Other than that, it's a pretty great game! Especially when you see the workshop content! All the awesome player and weapon skins, quite a few people have contributed to this game's greatness! And finally, I will get down to it.
Pros:
Decent Community
A great amount of workshop content
There is at least 1 public server with people in it 24/7
6 guns that are all special in their own way
You can literally just run around and knife people
Kill Deadpool as a duck with a Steam Sale RPG
You can literally have a stick thin gun
Blowing up everything is fun
The fact that you don't pay for new skins, and still have CS:GO skins

Cons:
Some parts of community are a bit iffy than the rest
If you suck at aim, you will suck at the game (not guarenteed)
The spawnkilling techniques of some players, rip
The fact that there's only one map for Hunt

So yeah, that's my review on the game. Still though, the spawnkills.

reviewText:
An incredibly customizable, skill-based fps with destructible maps!

Pros :
- Customization ! Create your guy, create your weapon, create your map, and FIGHT!
- Counter-strike style of shooting. Learn your guns!
- Destructible maps! Dig new ways in, barricade yourself or create a bunker in the middle of a battle.
- Did I mention CUSTOMIZATION?! It's all over the place!
- Check out user-created content, download and modify content!

Cons :
- Hard to find alot of servers at all times due to small playerbase
- People using the customization to hide (smallest/grey playermodels/guns) instead of being creative

Recommended!

reviewText:
Blockstorm is a FPS into the world triumphant genre but this time it’s with a twist a Minecraft twist in fact! This game is basically Minecraft with guns!

You are able to pick a class! You can create your own maps and character skins too play with and for others to download using the Blockstorm forum’s.
This game is confusing to start, because as soon as you join you have so idea what to do it’s like going to a shop and buying things without a tag on it. On the other hand once you get used to the game and understand how to play and everything like that it is VERY easy!

The character customization is amazing with over 20 default characters but when you play with players who have made a skin it automatically downloads it! You can customize your character from head to toe.


Pro:
◾Gorgeous blocky graphics.
◾Awesome playability.
◾High-level of customization.


Cons:
◾No singleplayer story mode or offline mode.
◾No tutorials.

reviewText:
Really fun game! Has sort of a Counter-Strike and Ace of Spades/Minecraft feel. Making custom skins is fun, but if you're like me and you're lazy, you can subscribe to some workshop items and immedaitely get decked out.

The gamemodes are pretty simple and not a pain to play when the map changes, although some maps and gamemodes are pretty onesided (assault/defend). No weapon is really OP, it all depends on the situation and how much ground your team has covered. The shotgun is, in my opinion, the least useful weapon though, as it fires slowly and doesn't kill point-blank. That's what knives are for.

Mechs are a great help offensively, but they aren't too tanky, which means a handful of players could focus on it and easily take one out if the pilot isn't paying attention.

Play this game and poop on some kids = u=b

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nBlockstorm is a great way to use up your small amounts of unnecessary free time.  The games only take about 10 minutes, but it feels a lot longer than 10 minutes.  With this game, you can play as Jesus (or Satan if you swing that way), Batman, characters from payday, and many more.  The community is really nice, and the developers are really responsive.  It might be in early access, but it could be sold as is and I would still buy it again.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe premise of this game: Modern Warfare meets Minecraft has been done before, but never so well. Even as it stands (in beta as I write this) the game's physics just feel right": Movevement and aiming are tweaked so the game does not feel like it is getting in the way and the guns feel accurate and powerful. The maps are varied so that some favor sniping and others run and gun.  The community and developers are regularly adding to the list
date: keeping the game fresh.  On most maps EVERYTHING is destructible which can be hilarious at times. There are not a whole lot of players online but I have never been left wanting for a match - most rounds have more than 8 players.  Devs are working actively to squash bugs and expand the game.\n\nAll in all this is one of the best games in the sub $20 catagory."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Blockstorm. What can I say?

Brilliant.

This game, though at this point in time it is in the Early Access stage, is an absolutely amazing game that requires you to fight against others using weapons of all sorts in a multiplayer battle. With 3 different game modes to choose from (Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch & Assault), this game offers players a beautiful gameplay experience. It's like a mix of Minecraft and Battlefield, with all your blocks and whatnot and then your weapons, like AK's, RPG's and grenades that can be used tactically against the enemy, or can cause complete and utter mayhem. Apart from the game's beautiful gameplay, the ability to create your own character (apart from the dozens already provided) is quite unique compared to other games and also the ability to create your own map, if you wish. Can't be bothered to make your own skin? Doesn't matter! You also have the ability to download other people's skins if you wish to.

Unfortunately, with the numerous servers provided, not many people seem to join all the time, but usually there is a game in Team Deathmatch - probably the most joined gametype - with about 10/16 people. Normal Deathmatch and Assault rarely have many players on the servers, but nevertheless, this issue doesn't make the game any worse. Another situation that players seem to face quite quickly is the lack of weaponry and equipment provided. There are 6 primary weapons provided and 3 secondary weapons, but the combination of weapons to choose from is quite small, and I hope, later on, that the developers add more weapons to this game. There will most likely be more to this, but with the slot for your knife and shovel, no other options for equipment are provided, so hopefully the developers are able to add more equipment in to make this game much more polished before it's full release.

I completely trust what the developers are doing in order to make this game even more brilliant than it already is for it's full release. Right now, the game might be worth $11.99 USD, but anybody who wishes to buy this game will be more than happy with their purchase. I completely recommend this game to any others that wish to purchase this game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I absolutely love this game!



PRO'S:


The map creator and the character creator are both equally fun to use and very innovative.

The gameplay and/or gunplay is amazing and  satisfying  , the gun balance is incredibly well-done.

Controls are simple but really familiar, being  similar to Counter-Strike and other voxel-based shooters.

The graphics in this game are actually quite great, including features like Anti-aliasing, dynamic shadows, bloom and lens flares.

Game performance for an early access game is incredible, no stuttering and no frame-drops at no times during gameplay. Blockstorm uses the Unity engine, which is known to be a very well-known engine and many of the games we know and love have been built using the same engine Blockstorm uses. Don't forget that the Unity engine allows the devs to create ports for their games so I expect Blockstorm to expand onto Mac OSX and Linux in the near future.


CON'S:


Lack of people playing. I know this isn't the game's fault for this as you can see throughout my review, but the game has a few number of people playing everyday, peaking at around maybe 20 people online playing the game. Here's the official charts. [steamcharts.com]




Overall, Blockstorm is an simple, yet fun to play game and I would recommend it to anyone who loves a good shooter.
My advice if you enjoy the game, spread the word across your friends, our community we have here as Steam, tell them that this game is a well-done and a enjoyable game, this amazing game needs to be heard across the whole internet so we have more people playing and enjoying this.

Thank you for reading, I hope my efforts will improve upon the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Blockstorm is a voxel FPS shooter game with amazing gunplay, character creation, and map designing.
I was hessitant to buy this, after seeing the reviews of Ace Of Spades, and Guncraft.

I decided to buy this out of the 3 to see how it would go. I'm glad I did buy this.


Features include:

Easy to use map editor

Intuititive character creator (Here is a character I made just to show you what you can do https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/4eomfrsfv7unbjj/Snapshot-000277.png)

Fantastic gunplay.

Some suggestions I have:
Workshop (For maps and characters alike)
Co-operative gameplay (Fight against waves of X, X and X, ect)
Bigger back space (I want to let my Space Engineers character have a larger backpack :) )
Sandbox mode
A way to invite your friend(s) to help build a character/map (Could make awesome maps together)

Cons:
This is a con sometimes, but the community is small. You can help by buying the game and playing it!

If you think the game is bad, you should still give it a try. It may be worth your time :)

I rate this game 8/10. (Early Access rating, subject to change)


Just for fun, here are some characters I have made (may update the list later when I make more)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My first impressions of Blockstorm is it is a fun game if you can find a good server. There was a lot of rudeness and just simply put unfun maps thrown at me in my first hour or two of gameplay. Ping was also an issue but this is understandable with a game with a very small community I often had no choice but to join EU servers.

What I think has the most potential is the editing. Utilizing the fact that you are in voxel worlds is important in games like this and the devs did a wonderful job implementing a very user-friendly character and map editor. If I had any artistic bone in my body I would have loved to use this tool to personalize my character to my liking.

I think it's to early to give this game a good or a bad rating but I will say it needs a lot of work and be prepared for some annoyance if you support them in early access.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's a better Ace of Spades. It has more customization options, better character models, and much better lighting effects and such.

If you don't know any previous genres of blocks+guns, this is like Counter Strike meets Minecraft blocks. As in, guns can mow down forests. You can collapse a building with a player in it and kill them.

Character models can be completely built. This allows for some pretty nifty choice in look (Slenderman, anyone?)

All in all, this game looks pretty cool.

To all the negative reviewers: Yes, there is a lack of players. But for the five negative reviews, you could all be playing on one server. And if you review it badly, not as many people will get it, and so you are causing the game to be empty! Make it a good review, and watch the player count blossom. (To people reading this and worrying: The player count is growing :) )

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game Rating - 4.5/5
PROS -
+Destruction is epic.
+Weapons feel good.
+Character and map customization are fantastic features.
+Slick and friendly menu UI.
+Responsive and active developers.

CONS -
+Player base is small. (for now)


This game is great! Player customization, destruction, and gun-play is the heavy focus in this minecraft-inspired FPS. The developers allow for the player to be as deep or simple with customization. The customization tools are fairly easy to get the hang of. Destruction is something that is far underused in video games today. I can safely say that Block Storm does destruction justice. Walls will explode and crumble as you fire upon them. Buildings will fall to the ground if there is no support. The map becomes a wasteland by the end of the match. The gun-play in this game is executed very well. Players are not difficult to see or shoot on the battlefield because the models of the players in-game are the perfect blend of block and realism. Overall, Blockstorm is a breath of fresh air in the FPS genre.

RATING - 4.5/5

reviewText:
Early Access Review

tl;dr:  BUY THIS GAME.

from online review:

Some games have teams with guns. Some games have shovels and blocks. Blockstorm, available in Early Access, is both, in an FPS that looks like it was built with pristine, never-been-stepped-on, never-chewed-on-by-your-kid-sister blocks.

The worlds designed with these Bigass Pixels are surprisingly gorgeous. Dusty Moroccan scenes and train stations (heyyyy...). Also, mountain passes and buildings with elaborate paths, and about a dozen ways across the mirrored team maps.

Falling trees can kill, with hot shovel-on-tree action. Foxholes can be dug, as can tunnels. Jumping (slightly-lowered gravity, no turning in a jump) can be positively lethal. Headshots are possible from half a map away.

YES, it is possible to machine-gun a hole in a wall from which your teammates can snipe. Or quickly block off an entrance with your Magical Backpack Full Of Concrete.

A Very Long String Of Tastless & Offensive Expletives, this is cool. Get In This New World, And Now. This is undoubtedly One Of This Summer's Games.

(full version at feedmepixels website)
