reviewText:
Early Access Review

There ae a lot of questions that come up with this game, so let me keep this introduction brief. If you're like me, you've probably played several of these Early Access/Beta games and have been burned a few times by lack of content and general poor quality. Some I like (Prison Architect, Project Zomboid, Space Engineers), others I've quickly forgotten about. This is a game that makes the former list and will continue to recieve my support.

For some background, you shold familiarize yourself with a couple of other games- Minecraft (everyone knows of); Silent Storm (A tactical 3rd person RTS that has a fully destructable environemnt); The Battlefield games; King Arthur's Gold.

This game combines elements of each of those previous games and does most of it better than similar titles.

The resolution: It's a higher quality than Minecraft and in general, the graphics are a better quality than most Voxel games like it. If you blow up a block, for instance, the block explodes into dozens of smaller ones, that each obey the laws of physics. This lends itself nicely to a realistic feel in a gunfight, as the terrain and environment turn to rubble and dust around you!

Physics: Structures actually obey the laws of physics (mostly); if you blow up the base of a freestanding object, the rest crumbles (In the style of a 3d King Arthur's Gold).

The Editors: This is where the game really shines! Look at the artwork the community has done in regards to characters. There are so many small details you can edit, you can let your imagination run wild!

The map editor is also very detailed, allowing you to create huge structures, or vast fields. Were you a kid that liked playing with Legos and then destroying your masterpieces with as much ingenuity as you were legally allowed? That's the map editor in a nutshell :)

You can then take these creations and share them online with other players in game, or via the forums. Which brings me to....

Community: Small but active. Devs and Admins regularly interact on the forums, answering questions and giving feedback. You get the sense that they really are relying on the players to help them shape the game... unlike soooooo many other games on this Steam list.

And then we get to the bad...

Population: Is depressingly low. I've yet to see more than 10 people on a server. However, when you combine this with all of the above and the Early Access state of the game, there really isn't much you can complain about. IN some cases, playing may even become secondary to creating maps and characters!

Early Access Review

I get it from Indiegala Project X. So I don't know if it deserve to be bought or not in a early access. Just I can tell to you that in that stage Blockstorm have done a good impression, more than you can see on trailers or gameplays.

Is just simple: run and edit if you want a map or character with personalization, or directly go to play (deathmatchs, teamdeathmatch and assault mode, in present...) and stay fun in a easy way to entertain a game really customizable and with good playability for being an indie shooter.

With friends this game can go to be one my favourite multi FPS easily. Remembers me old times with counter strike... but now in voxel customizable.

Yes, I recommend to play more than to see videos, if you got luck to play with friends fun is guaranteed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you are a fan of voxel shooters like Ace of Spades, Guncraft, or Paranautical activity, then look no further. Blockstorm is the an epic addition to the voxel shooter genre and is one you MUST PLAY. If you are fan of Ace of Spades, you are familiar with the immense customization that it offers. Blockstorm off even more in the sense of that, allowing you to customize the not just the look of your ENTIRE charater, but the maps as well. You can build, you can destroy, you can wreak havoc on other players. What more could you want from something like this? While, yes, it is still in development, for what it is right now, it is more than worth your money. This game is shaping up to be something INCREDIBLE (that's assuming it can even get more incredible than it already is). While the gameplay may feel slower than you are used to at first, one quickly gets used to it and can fully immerse themselves in something great. The game allows you to fully customize your loadouts as well, something AOS does not offer. Blockstorm even goes so far as to allow the player to create custom characters to go with the loadouts, and save them for later use. The fast paced action and strategy that goes into shaping the match to your advantage easily launches this game into the top 10 voxel shooters ever created. The game runs very quickly, even on older hardware, making this game accessible to everyone, even those without dedicated graphics! You don't need fancy gaming computer to play this, making it extremely accesible to anyone who wants to give it a shot. The movement is smooth, and the gameplay as a whole is even smoother. Not to mention an epic soundtrack!

All in all, I give this game a 9/10 and would recommend it to anyone who needs something to play. Keep in mind, I give it a 9/10 and it hasn't even finished development. In its current state, it beats out many of the other games of the same genre with ease, and only looks to be getting better. If you only have ten bucks to spare, and were wondering which game to choose, choose Blockstorm. You will not be dissapointed.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

You might think this is an Alpha version of Ace of Spades and it kinda is. The game literally look like a Minecraft texture pack and i would know that since i played the Beta a lot. It might be weird for you at first since you are 3 blocks high instead of 2(+1 point for originality(even though in Terraria is 3 as well)). There are several different maps to play at and some are smaller than medium sized cave in Minecraft(I am comparing stuff to Minecraft because that's probably where the ideas were taken from). You can dig and place blocks like Ace of Spades. Bullets break blocks which means if you are in a small map after about a minute the terrain is going to be half way gone. The gameplay is IMO is bad, but some people im sure will like.

The game is still in Alpha and giving 12 euros is just stupid. You can probably get it for free from Indie Gala like i did, but i personally don't give more than 10 cents for this game. If you are interested in those types of games i would recommend waiting for it until it comes out. The game can't offer much right now and you can't know for sure if it's going to be released officially.

I'll put on Do you recommend this game?" a "Yes" for now because for an Alpha it works and has more stuff than i thought
date: but just go and buy Ace of Spades if you want to play a Minecraft FPS. I might update the review after the game is in Beta but for now that's all."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

After i tried games like ace of spades or guncraft when i saw this game om the store i though ''this is just another one of those games'' but well, i was bored so i gave the game a shot since it has a demo and i saw that the game has a lot of potential (keep in mind its an early acces).
The game now has 3 game modes, assault (attack/defend), team deathmatch and deathmatch (free for all) and there are more game modes ''comming soon'', the game game gives us many options to play with when we are in a match since apart from the weapons we have 99 cubes per live (yes, they refill when you respawn) to build bases, walls or high places to use the sniper riffle, also we have a spade so we can dig tunnels and whatever you may imagine.
Although right now th game lacks weapons (in numbers) the weapons we already have are very balanced and they actually have weight (which affect our speed). The devs are very present, listening to the community and fixing bugs (hope they don't abandon the game though)
Another feature of the game (the one that made me love the game) is the creation of characters and stages. The character creation gives you the opportunity of making a character cube by cube so it gives you infinite chances to create a unique character. I haven't tried the stage creation but a friend has and he said me that it was very complete.
in resume the game is very complete and has a lot of pottential but it deppends if the devs keep updating the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is really fun and I absolutely love the character creation. I've been wanting a game with such in-depth character customization and this is it, Blockstorm.
TL:DR; This game is an absolute blast and its worth the money. If you want to read the full pro/con list, read on below.
Here my list of Pros and Cons;
PRO'S:
-Character editor. This game has got an amazing character customizer and you can personalize your character to the max. I've spent a while just perfecting mine and I'm definitely gonna make more and more in the future. The character editor is easy to use but very imposing when you first look at it. It took me about 10 minutes to get used to it but from then on I felt like a professional character designer. If you encounter a player with a skin that you think is awesome, no need to fear, the game automatically downloads it and places it in the category 'Downloads'. This might annoy some people (not me though :D) so an option to turn that off would be nice. It might already be there but I haven't found one. That could just be me though.
-Map editor. You can go wild with your imagination and create your own map that you can battle it out on against your friends and enemies. There are a few presets that you can choose from and continue building from there or you can start from scratch. I'm defintely going to make a Doom™ themed map in the near future, you can count on that. If you are a keen Minecraft player and you love to build amazing creations, then you will love this.
-Weapons. The weapons in this game are pretty awesome, my personal favorite is the Sniper Rifle (one shot kill >:D) with the handgun as my secondary. The weapons are pretty balanced from what I gather and weight is a factor in this game which many games can forget about. The heavier the weapon is the slower you will go, but don't let that stop you from taking a rocket launcher seconded by an uzi into a head-on fight. Good fun. I would love to see more variety in the future, or maybe a shop interface where you can buy weapons with money that you earn from kills (similar to Counter Strike) that resets with each new game, as to keep it balanced. But definitely more weapons please :D
-Map interaction. You can build, destroy and completely obliterate most of the map, which is AWESOME. You get given 100 blocks that you can go wild with. You could build a small defensive fort to defend against attackers, create a small house to stay safe in or you could build some stairs to get up on to high places etc. I wouldn't mind seeing more variety in the blocks you could choose from (although building isn't the primary focus in the battlefield) because the standard block looks a little bland. But, it's early access and the game has yet to evolve, so things might change in the future. You can also dig with your shovel, which is a handy way to ambush people or to hide away (LIKE A COWARD, GET OUT THERE AND FIGHT! >:D) etc. If you had some different blocks it would be a great way to fool someone into a trap/ambush and destroy them. But I digress. Maybe some special blocks e.g. Fake Blocks that crumble when you walk over it as you fall into an abyss of C4 and death or Jumper Blocks that launch people high into the air. You could place fake blocks and then put jumper blocks under them and turn the enemy into swiss cheese as they fall to the ground. I've gotten a little off track. Anyway...
-Music. The music in this game is so badass and awesome and makes you feel like the ultimate alpha who wrecks noobs left right and centre. That's all I can and need to say about the music.
-Matchmaking. The quick match matchmaking system is fast and simple. Not much else to say about that.

CON'S:
-Music. The only problem I have with the music is it doesn't actually play during the match, which I'm disappointed about. That could be my fault, but I'm not entirely sure. It would be a nice small touch of just adding an option to have music in game or not.
-Players. And by players, I mean IT NEEDS MORE PLAYERS TO BE PLAYING!! Other than that, the player's I've encountered so far have been good natured and fun to play against, which a lot of communities lack; a nice playerbase. Although, with the growth of a playerbase it increases the amount of trolls and unkind players who ruin the experience for others. So far I haven't had the 'pleasure' of meeting one in-game. Yet. Which is a good sign. As soon as I do though, they're getting a bullet in the face. Many times.

All in all this game is a must-buy (especially since it's in early access and you can have your say in the game's future design!) and I highly recommend it. From what I've seen the interaction between the Devs and the players is quite frequent (unlike SOME voxel based game Devs *cough* Wollay *cough*) which is a good sign. This is my two cents of thought, a bit of a read but if you made it this far then I applaud you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Really enjoy the atmosphere of the game.

Blockstorm has a lot of user friendly options, which include the following - I'll make a list of Pros & Cons

Pros:
Nice texture detail
Shading - In block based type of games, I'm really happy that one (Blockstorm) has decent shading
The Music - Keeps you on your toes
Balanced weapons - A bunch of different weapons for different slots to fit your playing style
Player Customization - In most games, you slightly alter appearances. In Blockstorm, you customized virtually every pixel on your body (NOTE: Legs, arms, hands, and feet mirror.) BTW: they give awesome premade costumes which you can customize even further (mainly military, law enforcement, Game Creator skins)
Maps - Pretty balanced maps, with (Currently) three different game modes
Custom Maps - You can create your own map with world options such as fog, background, water/lava, etc.


Cons:
Community - Unfortunently, with free, noncensored character customization, you can get pretty inappropriate costumes at times, which are downloaded from other online players into your personal library of costumes
Gamemodes - Fun, yes, but would be better with more options
Block durability - Either I haven't found it, but I'd like certain blocks to be unbreakable in the game. Blocks break after taking a certain ammount of damage, so hiding behind cover won't work for long


**Special OP Weapon Hints**
Don't tell anybody, but here's my statagies to using OP weapons

Sniper Rifle - destroys most block with one shot, kills players with one shot. Don't quickscope, but aim right and you can kill them before their automatic weapons can do more than 33% damage on you.

Rocket Launcher - Takes time to lock on to a poition and fire, but has a blast radius so large you can practically just aim it near the person to finish them off instantly. Ducking behing cover? Nah. If you see a person using it though, make sure you stay undetected or hi-tail it outta there.

And there's my basic overview/review of the game. 8-9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Blockstorm works, but needs more people and that will change with time. Blockstorm has a winning formula here and if it can get some healthy starter levels made by the community, it could really take off. With customizable maps and characters and with completely destructible environments, Blockstorm almost has it all. If they get a decent size community with maps that illustrate what an user can create and possibly a way to share character skins it would help this ship set sail. This is one of those games that will rely on word of mouth to spread. If you’re a fan of shooters and either don’t care or can get over the Minecraft graphics, you owe it to yourself to try out Blockstorm.

Full Review: TheVideogameBacklog.com

reviewText:
I recently picked up this game on sale, and I have to say that it is one of the best value purchases I've ever made on Steam.  I highly enjoy both Minecraft and CS:GO, so it is a natural fit.  I find the actual gun combat to be only so-so; it seems some guns are more usable than others and the motion isn't exactly fluid, but overall it is fun and adequate given the other stellar features of this game.

The customization options in this game are what truly won me over.  The Steam Workshop already has TONS of custom skins for characters, guns, melee weapons, tools, and NPC skins, along with custom maps and an in-depth map editor somewhat similar to Minecraft.  The character and gun customization tools are wonderfully in-depth and easy to pick up.  I made a few of my own custom guns and had a blast doing so, considering you can change both the shape and colors of the guns to fit your look.

The built-in maps are solid, and if you enjoy Minecraft resource packs there's a lot of really nice scenery and building inspiration in this game.  Obviously you can make your own maps, and host your own servers with those maps, which I find to be really cool.  Some maps are designed just for singleplayer or co-op with NPC and item placements.  The scenarios that you can create in this game have the potential to be fairly interesting once you get a grasp of the mechanics.

Overall, this is a really solid bang for your buck title.  Even at the regular price it's a great value purchase.  There are a lot of Minecraft wannabe games out there, but this one really deserves a look if you're a First Person Shooter fan.  Since its a new game, there may be updates to hope for in the future, but it's already a very enjoyable experience in its current state.

reviewText:
Blockstorm is one on THE most fun games I have played in a while, and there aren't a lot of games on PC I have owned and can proudly say are purely enjoyable.

The mechanics, for an early access are very impressive and I have yet to find any major glitches that can be exploited for unintentional game usage. I would be happy with this game even if it were a full release and all for quite the reasonable price tag.

The class layout is great, and the variety in weapons and tools are evident, however there are those times where you feel quite limited in what you can choose, but hopefully this will be fixed upon full release.
There really isn't an OP weapon, and by OP I don't just mean how many shots it takes to kill, I'm talking about how they all compensate themselves in different ways.
For example: The sniper (seemingly) Is always a one hit kill, but compensates with only one bullet per reload, which means if you're a bad shot, it will at least take you another 10 seconds to re-align your aim. That is, if you're not already dead or the enemy hasn't gotten away.

Unfortunately there aren't many servers and players within Blockstorm, and most of them are demo players. However you can still play with these people and servers. And it's clear that the amount of players are growing, very gradually, but growing nonetheless. (Plus it's an early release, what the hell do you expect?)

Yes I know this review may be a tad biased, but if you play this game, you'll understand why. It's such a fun game and the limits in your strategy are pretty small.

I just hope that the fan base doesn’t turn out to be ravaging 12 year olds or self-loathing Russians like the rest of 'em...

Other than that 10/10. Get it pls. Gd luck. C:

reviewText:
Early Access Review

*NOTE: This is an Early Access review meaning it will be a lot shorter than a normal review but will still explain what I thought about it. A full review will be published once Blockstorm has released. You can also skip down to the ending to see my final score.

Blockstorm is a voxel FPS game set in a world made of destructible blocks. All maps and characters included in the game are made with the same tools that are available to the public. You can build everything in Blockstorm, and you can destroy it. Blockstorm was developed by GhostShark and published by IndieGala.

After playing Ace of Spades and Guncraft I've been a little skeptical on any voxel first person shooters. But, I was definitely wrong. In its early access state, Blockstorm provides more to do than Guncraft and Ace of Spades combined. You can build maps with the spectacular map editor, create your own skin, or even download other people's skins! The replyability of Blockstorm is definitely there along with a fantastic FPS design. With being able to customize almost anything, you can practically have a new experience everytime you play a match. Each match is quick enough so you won't lose interest while playing as a character.

Blockstorm does lack in game modes with only providing classic deathmatch, team deathmatch, and another mode named Assault". The game modes all work well and would definitely suffice if those were the only modes
date: but the more gamemodes the merrier.\n\nOverall
recommended: Blockstorm provides an excellent new addition to the FPS community and is definitely worth a playthough if you're interested in Voxel FPS like Ace of Spades or Guncraft.\n\nFinal Score: 8.5/10"

reviewText:
TL;DR - 8/10, but still definitely recommended.

GAMEPLAY - 7/10
First of all, this plays just like minecraft - except with guns. The graphics, although being similar to block-based games, are very nice and aren't cheap in any way. The gameplay, on the other hand, is less solid. There are not too many hackers in the servers, however the scoring system for the game is pretty rough. You often won't get points for a kill or a flag capture.

MODES - 10/10
One feature of this game that I love is the amount of different game modes. Instead of being a typical deathmatch-based game, there are plenty of other ways to play.

CUSTOMIZATION - 10/10
In Blockstorm, you can totally customize the look of your soldier, bases, gear, everything. This really gives it a unique aspect that is akin to CS:GO.

GRAPHICS - 9/10
Let's face it - it's Minecraft. The graphics are nice, but only 9/10 because it's not really my style and there could be more textures/block types.

reviewText:
Another Minecraft look-a-like game much like Ace of Spades. Although it feels more like a combination of Call fo Duty 2, Day of Defeat (Source) and of course...Minecraft. Suprisingly, it's pretty fun!

Lots of character skins to choose from, lots of weapons, great music and gameplay.
You can even customize your character and weapon skins, square by square, pixel by pixel, if you're really hardcore. I've seen someone as a Clone StormTrooper and some cool weapon skins.
Your health regenerates after awhile, so falling from high brick-top-trees doesn't hurt too bad.
The weapons are pretty balanced, except for the Desert Eagle Deagle" which takes a whole clip to kill someone
date: and the MP5 that's insanely accurate for long range kills.\nYou also get blocks/brick in your inventory that you can use to build whatever you want; barricades
voteText: you name it! Whick is helpful since certain (most) blocks/environment can (and will) be destroyed by shooting at them.\n\nGreat game
helpfulPercent: especially with friends!\n\n7/10"

Early Access Review

thank you indigala for such a nice next-gen gaming experience.
Game ran smoothly at 8 fps with medium resolution and low settings with my intel intergrated gpu (because my old video card = dead, no sarcasm intended.) and I was suprised how well optimized game was. (well, it's not a heavy graphic game released by AAA publishers like u-buysoft and such.) So far, being able to customize and choosing your own arsenal was the keypoint during the gameplay and it was fun enough for an early access game.

you might say, there are other games like ace of spade,guncraft and blah blah but 10 times better. (but seriously who cares, it is still in early access and might be better on full release), you get workshop support that gives you guns,characters and maps or make your own stuff. overall it's nice game to try out/buy and play it whenever you are bored. 9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alright.. Time for a review..
For a mac user myself..

I would only like to complain one thing..

The Startup Menu in the first start of the game.
This needs to be changed to non-animated menu.

So we MAC users don't buffer out of the game.
But other than that the game runs pretty well on a Mac,

The only issue is the menu being animated,

Having to go to the menu after finishing a match in a server or exiting
out of the creation menu takes ages to load,

I advice they do something about the menu
Being animated & all.

The thing i love about this game?

Everything,
Being able to make maps of your own & share it to others is the best.

Specially when you're allowed to make whatever you want,
Even if its just character creation or Map creation.

But in other words.
The game is awesome in general.

10/10 Would recommend this game to everyone.

reviewText:
Here is my 30 Second Game Review:

https://youtu.be/V_9SJVNyXa4

Minecraft meets Call of Duty and it is AWESOME. Build something, shoot someone and destroy everything in your path.The map is constantly changing so the focus is on skill and reaction speed, just like every FPS should be. But choose your weapon carefully, since it affects your speed.

The hardest thing in the game is to get bored. You get lots of playing modes like Deathmatch, TDM, CTF, and Hunt. But the most unique one is Castle, where each team fortifies a castle and then has to destroy the enemy team’s one.

Buildable maps and costumizable characters turn this into a game where you can create your own fun. And you will.

8 voxels out of ten.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I will first start off with saying that this is the first review I have ever written on a game on Steam. This should also bring confidence to potential buyers of this game.

PROS:

I have found this game to be outstanding. First off, the game is literally like 150 mb (as of Sept. 9, 2014); I was blown away by this. The game is VERY well optimized and runs extremely smoothly.

There is an option to select which weapons you would prefer as your primary, secondary, and grenade/bazooka slot. The primary weapons range from a standard semi auto rifle, AK47, sniper, belt-fed machine gun, and shotgun. The secondary weapons range from pistol, shotgun, uzi. Finally, the grenade slot ranges from a standard grenade, RPG, and one more thing (can't remember at the moment).

One of the things that make this game so unique is the fact that each weapon has a specific weight. With increase in weight, the slower you run (and significantly I might add). This helps mitigate the overuse of some weapons. For example, If you were to equip the belt-fed machine gun, Shotgun, and rpg, your character would run so slow that it would make you an easy target. So balancing your weight is a must.

Another fantastic feature is that the environment is completely destructible. I have seen building in a map completely collapse when the lower blocks are destroyed. I am serious.. it isn't like minecraft where blocks will still be floating. If you blow-out the lower structure blocks in a building, the building actually collapses.. that is so cool!

CONS:

Everything has a good and a bad. The cons I found for this game was the limited number of weapon choices (however, dev's are likely going to be adding more). There is currently only Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, and Assult (atk and def); it would be nice if there were more game options. Final con, not at many people playing as I have hoped for.

Conclusion:

I am one to cringe at early access games, however, this one has definitely change that. I found this game to be exceptional for what it is worth and have had a great time. Also, developers are ALWAYS talking with players on the community channel so check it out!

9/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Minecraft + Counter Strike  = Blockstorm


10/10
voteText: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Blockstorm is a voxel FPS that has a wonderful system but with poor gameplay quality.

Blockstorm is unique. Players have nearly 100% freedom in designing their own character, equipment and even maps. Designes can be shared through Steam Workshop, in which others simply need to click 'Subscribe' in order to download the designs and use it for their own.

However, these are the only things that attracts me to this game.
The gameplay itself is boring as ♥♥♥♥.

Currently, there are only RPG, LMG, MP5, AK, UZI, Shotgun, Sniper, rifle and handguns in which all of these have horrible sound effect and it makes you feel like you're using a card board gun made in China.

Character actions are basic and you are only limited to aim-shoot, run, crounch and jump. No sprinting, diving, or lying on the ground. If you want to play Super Mario in 3D, this game is for you.

Grenades are ♥♥♥♥ing annoying in this game. Each players are supplied with 2 grenades every spawn and this makes the match into a grenade dodgeball where players throw their grenade before they shoot when they see an opponent.

Knifes are also one slice kill with zero sound effect where it makes you feel like you're cutting through tofu.

The only unique part about the game play is that the blocks are destructable, and it is interesting seeing the battlefield constantly change its shape and how players must move differently according to the change.

But remember, the rest is total sh!t.

The only hope to enjoy this game is to use most of your time designing and if you are want a good gameplay experience, I recommend you to bring your friends.

Overall:
Good concept but lack of polishing.

I understand that the game community is not big yet and the devs do not have a large income from this game, but this is my honest impression of this game at its current state.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Im just going to post a basic little first thoughts review.

The game isn't bad. It's like a nice more advanced version of Ace of Spades in my opinion. Gameplay is simple. Run, shoot, hide, build. It's not very fast paced. It's fairly relaxed and there is no singleplayer with AI etc.

The amount of weapons you have to choose from is alright. Nothing really fancy. But the weapons do their job. I'd say there is room for more unique weapons though if the developer is interested in adding more out there" kind of weapons.

I'd say despite this being an early access game. It is looking fairly polished with the content so far. There aren't many gamemodes as of yet. But there are apparently more coming soon.

I do not know the plans for the game once it's finished (this is an early access review) But I do feel this game lacks in content that could increase fun in gameplay. Be it an improvement to the way the world/maps are affected by the player(s)
date: maybe a singleplayer with monsters or something with little singleplayer missions (nothing fancy mind you
recommended: or perhaps some more unique weapons/items. But most important
hoursPlayed: I'd enjoy it more if there was a sprinting ability and being able to prone. Not just crouch.\n\nNow
voteText:
onto the verdect.

Do I recommend this game?
My answer is if you love(d) Ace of Spades and similar games. Then I'd say this game may just be something you'll enjoy. So yes. I'd recommend it.

Is it worth it's price of $12 right now?
I'd say it just meets my requirements for a yes at this point.

All in all. A nice little game. If you're unsure whether to get it. I would suggest watching some gameplay videos first before purchasing.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

For an early access I was skeptical, But it didn't take much more than the Title screen before I realized this game was trying hard to deveop itself at its own pace and POLISHed to boot.

Shortly: Game plays like counter Strike. Not too serious, But not too twitch-shootery either. Features and gamemodes are still being added, And game rooms tend to be empty unless you join around your area's Prime times or before school hours.

As I write this, There's CTF, DeathMatch, Team DeathMatch, Assault modes. Assault plays a bit like some form of land grab where the defending team must prevent the attacking team from occupying a specific zone or more for a certain amount of time.

The controls and interfaces for the game itself and it's various editors were a little different at first, But with a little learning and some wikis I found htem extremely intuitive for working with Voxels, And the editor for making your own skins is top-notch. Nothing is more satisfying than making your own, Unique skin or map.

Workshop integration launched recently too, And already is filling up with many quality prefabs, Maps and characters. So far for it's time, And the constant work and communication with the developers, This is promising to be the Well-made voxel shooter of the year if more players support this company.

Try the demo, Albeit you are limited in weapon map and skin it's a good sample of the fun that can be had in this game.

I would rate this 4/5 stars. And that's being picky about some features, But being an early access it could very well change the moment I hit 'POST' on this review..!

reviewText:
This game is fun, but it's annoying to say the LEAST. The weapons are extremely unbalanced, the pistol getting no love, needing about 20 shots for a single kill, while the rifle, sniper rifle, and shotgun all have an instant kill on close-mid range. luckily, the shotgun isnt distance, but OH BOY, here comes the AK-47.

Blockstrom Devs, why? why must you include such bulls**t in your voxel shooter? I swear, the distance on the AK is infinate, the ammount of times i've been hit across the map due to sheer spray n' pray in my direction baffles me. The community on this game is garbage.

Little to no active servers, and player skins so horrible you'd want to gouge your eyes out. Oh! get this, they included FALL DAMAGE in their voxel shooter!

Yeah
date:
So? Isn't that a feature in all modern shooters?" you might ask

YEAH! IT CERTAINLY IS! What I'm complaining about is the fact that you can't drop 10 blocks without dying.

reviewText:
This game is completely unoriginal. The artistic style is obviously another Minecraft clone. There is nothing new about the FPS gameplay. The soundtrack and sound effects sound like they were taken from a virus-ridden copyright-free sound bank. And I love it.

Put simply, this game is fun. You get to tunnel, build, and deconstruct the map according to your wishes. The ability to destroy and build terrain makes this game interesting. I have logged in a fair amount of hours and I am still enjoying this game. Even despite the very small amount of servers that are open most of the time, I have been having a blast with all the new ways you can play an FPS with destructable terrain. If the idea sounds good to you, get it for sure. It delivers on what it is.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SurzIybpxlc

reviewText: BlockStorm, a game with a tiny community that results in about 3-4 servers to chose from. Those who play on those servers are often laggers that just teleport all over the place, quite annoying for someone who likes the sniper. Gun balance is meh and community is a mix of really cool people and depressed CSGO players that come to BlockStorm so they can finially use that knife skin they masterbate to every night. Oh yeah and don't forget the complete noobs that think this game is Minecraft, and those who act this way for some annoying reason. Speaking of skins, the custom skins in this game might be the only reason to play it. If you are a nerd or... depressed CSGO player, you can use cool skins of things you like. The skins creator gives you customization of almost every block in the model consisting of probably thousands of blocks. There is a internal frame you can't change (otherwise you could have invisible skins) and an external limit to how many blocks you can add (otherwise there would be skins that take up the whole map. This allows you to use some of your favorite weapons from TV, other games, Anime, books, and basically whatever you want (some sorry souls make pen15 skins). I don't know about you but I am a nerd and love creating and playing as my favorite characters from other games and Animes. This game was pretty good but the community has been slowy rotting and now all there is are laggers and few servers avalible. I would recommend this game if not for the horrible lack of players. Also know that this game is not the most serious shooter ever, you are not getting CSGO lvls of recoil and the guns are limited.

reviewText:
Awesome customization. Fast and Fun gameplay. What would be an amazing game is deminshed greatly by issues we really shouldn't be seeing in games these days.

First off the game's player base is veeeeeeeery small. 1-2 partially filled rooms during even peak hours.
Don't like someone? Youre going to be playing with them or not playing.

Hackers. Yes there are sadly cheats for this game. You will occasionally run into ESP and Aim Bot users as well as cheats with the ability to pop any breakable block in 1 shot.

LAAAAAAG. This is one of those games that lets lag run wild. Players will appear to teleport and have insane speed bursts while still being able to accuarately mow you down. Lets not forget dying a full second after taking cover.

Permitted Abuse. The games customization is nice as stated but players will very commonly abuse it to make stick thin characters the color of the background.

No tools. The game is missing very common shooter tools such as vote kick... Many youre stuck on a single server with the above and you can't leave(if you want to play) or get rid of them.

It's almost a good game but it's weighted down by soooo much bullsh*t.
Pass.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Blockstorm is a fast paced FPS where each map is made of blocks – that’s right. They’re fully destructible. There are three main gamemodes and an editor mode that allows you to create and customize maps and characters in ways only a game made of blocks would let you.

Full video review: http://www.steamfirst.com/blockstorm-review/
voteText: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Blockstorm, this is one of those games that can give a large amount of replayability. The game features a few gamemodes such as Deathmatch, Team Deathmatch, Capture the Flag and Assault. The gameplay is well put and will be very familiar if you have ever played the original Ace of Spades and not the piece of crap remake.
The game also features two editors. A map editor and a character editor. The editors at first seem diffcult but once you find out what does what you should be able to use them just fine. The main thing I like about this game is the fact that you can have your own personalised character skin which you create yourself, which can take some time.
I'd recommend people buy this game now while it is still in the early stages, so you can see the game evolve into something greater. I'm even sure once more people find out about this game it will top that shotty remake of Ace of Spades. So come on down and join the battle.

10/10

reviewText:
this game has potential, however i cannot recommend it in ANY way in its current state.

- very poor balance, 1 shot everyone with an RPG or just run across the map with a shotgun being unstoppable
- little to none people playing, 4 of the gamemodes are completely offline.
- completely INFESTED with cheaters. infinite HP cheaters, wallhack cheaters, flying cheaters, aimbot cheaters... youll find them all here!
- game is completely abandoned by developers, the only updates" they make are bugfixes
date: they only added the MP5 since the game launched on steam and thats it.\n- VERY unbalanced maps
recommended: theyre either WAY too small to actually play in or are just too huge so everyone is a sniper.\nalso most of the time youll find that the opposite team has some much better tactical advantage over terrain.\n- toxic community
hoursPlayed: if you dislike Blockstorm theyll launch a "storm" of hate at you
voteText: also there are constant insults by random people of the community.\n- poor interface. no inventory
helpfulPercent: no progress
votesHelpful: no weapon stats
votesTotal: the only thing you can do to "progress" are achievements.\n- competitive matchmaking is completely no different from a normal match
votesFunny: just the name is different.\n- you lose score by dying (what?)
commentsCount: which means if there is a cheater on the opposite team your score will most likely be negative
column16: which doesnt make any sense either.\n\nthe only thing i CAN recommend in this game is the weapon/character creator
column17: its fun to just mess with and you can make some sick looking stuff be it just recoloring the weapon or completely remodeling it."
column18: February 13

reviewText:
The customization is okay...that's really all I can say
just another Minecraft clone with guns and wonky controls
every match is very one sided (Blue Wins...every single time...no matter what?)
I also encountered a lot of lag, but that's just on my end I think
the games selling point is you can customize everything character, weapons, zombies, turrets, levels. but that being said customizeing anything takes forever and doesn't feel at all natural, and it's the internet! with you know people! human people! with no limits on what they can make! vulgar characters, weapons, zombies, turrets and probably levels too I never encountered any user made levels I'm unclear how that works?

anyway it is early access so hopefully in the future some of these things will be fixed, there is good here it's just outweighed by the bad. so wait for a big sale and a few updates and it might be worth eh 3 bucks or something. I really do wanna support the developers though so if you do play and like it write a review, report bugs suggest changes and maybe the community can help make this the next big thing...

reviewText:
The good: Lots of customization, fun with friends, runs well and looks better than most of its style.

The meh: No real tutorial or single player practice for new players, which multiplies the community issues.

The bad: The balance, the pace, the lack of using the actual block building mechanics, not many active players, the hacks, the community and it's general attitude.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Now, granted my low play time, here is my experience of this game's play before you pay beta:

PROS:
Superb customization
Pretty fun gamemodes
Editors are a lot of fun to mess around with

GRAY:
Minecraft asthetic
Long gun reloads

CONS:
Lack of gun stats (no idea what damage the weapon does)
Lack of maps
No ingame music (Not sure if intentional, but I have no ingame music)
Quite community (only 2/10 matches did I find people who spoke)

All in all; it's a fun customization game, but not exactly a fun gun game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

TLDR: It feels a lot like Murder Miners, except it plays about half as well in a lot of ways (and is a few times the price).

Pros
* You can design your own character entirely.
* The map editor seems really good and fairly well in depth.
* The UI is very clean, and the mini-map will show map elements even on custom maps.
Cons
* Hit detection is very inaccurate, and the hit-monitor is pretty difficult to see.
* grenades seem to have no graphical explosion effects.
* guns have no kick or recoil to them
* movement is ridiculously sluggish.
* Chat doesn't pop up when you start chatting. To see old messages, you have to use Tab and open up the scoreboard.
voteText: 9 of 22 people (41%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It's ♥♥♥♥.

The controls are floaty, the weapons are imbalanced, the maps flat out bad.

I had some hopes for the customization features, but they're not worth the actual gameplay. Obviously there's a base to all models, to avoid people using invisible items / playermodels as tactical advantage- but the game would've been better off setting a minimum block count instead, so that when you /are/ actually creating something nice, you're not limited by the non-removable base blocks. (which can be recoloured, but that doesn't excuse their existence) The overall controls of the editor are horrid.

None of the weapons seem to feature any knockback, neither in dropping accuracy nor animation-wise, making the game overall feel, what's the word... bad. And the weapons' sounds don't help much to change that.

The default (not sure whether it's editable) map gravity is too low, making jumping feel very slow whilst you're still unable to jump very far. The fall damage badly reflects this by applying health subtractions of 2%, 75% and '♥♥♥♥ you you're dead now.'

Your movement speed is affected by the weapons you carry, which also means you can't equip certain combinations. Its not possible to lower it by e.g. not equipping a secondary item, which makes the whole system feel ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ overall.

The quickplay feature works decently, if not for the fact that you risk connection to community-made maps, which tend to be even worse than the official ones, as well as them occasionally not featuring an actual objective.

The iron sights don't actually line up, you just hold the gun slightly more ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ly and the hud-based crosshair remains in place.

Oh and the general mechanics aren't any good either, grenades simply drop out of your hand instead of being thrown, the sniper scope just makes your mouse move really slowly instead of dropping accuracy, etc etc.

At this time it's been in beta for almost a year, yet it still feels like it was conceptualized a week ago, just thought that was worth mentioning.

Worth playing while it's still in free beta? If you're an 11 y/o who isn't allowed to buy any games, sure, but it's still worse than other available free games.

Worth paying for? Not unless that would mean you'd get to slap the developers until they would make it a playable game.

reviewText: This is already out of Early Access? I don't believe it. It doesn't even feel ready. If you are from the US be prepared for people from the land of huehue,people saying they are not gypsies" and russians. Most people you play with are going to be 150-290ms (ping). The gameplay itself is pretty fun
date:
but you can get bored pretty quickly. There are plenty of Customization opitions aka skins for weapons and maps. What makes the game cool and interesting is the destruction of blocks. But ultimately I don't think this game is ready or even worth $6.99. I was lucky enought to win it from a giveaway. I'd say the game is worth $1.50 - $3.50 atleast when on sale.

Pros
+ Customized Maps and Skins
+ Destruction
+ Generic/Interesting Game Modes
+ Fun to mess around in game with friends having nothing better to do.

Cons
- Player Base (small)
- Hackers...
- Not Finished
- $6.99 buy it when on sale for atleast $1.50 - $3.50 hell maybe $3.50 is too much $3.00 might be better.
- Server Selection (lots of hosted games that don't show ping until you join) (there is host advantage)

As of right now I do not recommend this game until I see more added to it. But that is just me and this whole review is an opinion. It's up to you to decide what you do with your money
recommended: just trying to save you some time and money and to wait."

reviewText: Now don't take this non-reccomendation the wrong way- this game is pretty well made and fun to mess around in. The only reason I do not recommend this game is because a chunk of the active community i encountered seemed to have learned ways to play the game in ways that do not welcome in new players. In almost any game i went into, there were 1-2 players who had positions in the maps where they would look over the other teams spawn and just repeatedly spawn kill the other team.\n\nOther than that fact, the game itself was pretty enjoyable. Destroying an objects connection from the ground actually does cause the item to fall unlike minecraft and other voxel type games. I had fun playing in a closed game with some friends destroying the map and fighting eachother.

reviewText:
Yes it is fun, yes it is enjoyable, and yes you can have a fun time.
However
If you make a game that has the special feature of actually allowing you to customize the skin of your gun, but you SEVERELY LIMIT the customizer on some of the weapons, people are going to be very disappointed. For instance I wanted to make a Bolter Pistol, but since the Bolter Pistol is somewhat bulky, it wouldn't work, it just doesn't give you nearly enough room to expand on your ideas. The customizer needs serious work to allow people much more leeway with their ideas on weapon designs, and if you want to make a drum clip that is proportional to the rest of the gun, prepare to be sorely disappointed.

I was very excited to find out that weapon customization was a thing in this, and I was all hyped and excited, but I had all that crushed and disappointment set in. If this problem gets fixed then I might give a positive review.

reviewText: Weapon balance is awful and movement feels floaty. The game has so few players that the server browser sorts by number of players by default, as opposed to sorting by ping like most games, so it's pure luck to find a populated server with a decent connection. The default maps are both too open and offer little reason to build anything because even if you don't get shot while you weren't paying attention to your surroundings anyone can destroy your fortifications with a few explosives. The only part of this game that comes close to being decent is the character/equipment skin editor, and even that has poor controls and several limitations on what you can create.

reviewText:
Don't bother. The concept is great but the gameplay is stale and feels sluggish.

A destructive environment with player building and modifying weapons is an incredible idea and it IS executed in this game.

Imagine UT or Counter strike adding destructive environments.  Those games are games people play to compete with other plays. Would it add to the immersion? Yes. Would it make the actual competitive element better? no.

Would counter strike be as good with slower and sluggish movement, harder to see environment (due to the blocks),  and other items that detract from the competative element? No.

reviewText:
TL;DR at the bottom.

Now, saying a game is bad and that I, personally, wouldn't reccomend it is two different things that people often get mixed up about.

I don't have any major complaints about the game other than how it introduces new players.

I mean, the gameplay is smooth, the animations are good (for what is there) and the fact that they have implemented an in-game skin customiser that has workshop compatability is something that more games need to be doing. The voxel system is something I loved since I first played Ace of Spades on one of the free weekends.

However, I just can't understand how the game works.
I understand the premess of the game with it's objective systems yet I have no idea how the gun play works, of which many games at least show you a tutorial of this. Sure, I can look this up from other users yet I do fee the game should have some responsability in that department.

Also, I found that the choises for arnaments are very restricting. There were your base weapons (ARs, Shotguns, LMGs etc.) but that was it, really. I don't feel like I have as much freedom as some other games, which, as a user, I need to have to stay interested in the game. These also, to me, feel and move very clunky as well as the contraction time on crosshair. I personally think a few tweaks may be needed to make the guns feel like guns and not a lucile bat that sparks out bullets.

The maps that I play in the quick-join seem to be very small, restricting and quite dull. Now, I don't have enough experince to see how it works propperly, yet, if these are the maps the devs have made, I don't think a tiny 3-room map with a few corridors is enough for a CTF, maybe a DM or a small TDM.

TL;DR: I don't like the game for the gunplay, maps and how hard it is to get into, yet I do find the premess of the voxels and skin customisation very nice. It's a decent game, but, I can't say I like it.

reviewText:
Blockstorm is a good game with a lot of potential, but with it's confusing controls and servers overrun by hackers, I just can't recommend this at all.

I absolutely love the equipment/character/map editors and all that, but if you want to do this kind of stuff yourself, you might just want to find another game that allows you to do this. Guncraft, for example.

Unless you love hanging around hackers on the servers, don't waste your money on this.

(Also, I know I have about 0.5 hours on this game. I'm not exaggerating when I say that I found at least 3 hackers in that small playtime, with the others either being AFK or just trolls.)

reviewText:
*Note, this is a review from the very narrow perspective of a new player. I'm saying what I see.

Pro:
This game is very fun. The idea is great and it's VERY enjoyable to be able to make your own skins for yourself and your weapons. That alone makes the money I spent worth it.

There are plenty of game modes to choose from that all feel different. Every game mode has a different objective or approach to it and it actually is really enjoyable to bounce around to different modes.

Con:
Unless I'm crazy, the servers are very empty a lot of the time. Only 1 or 2 in any given timezone has players-even though there's like 5 or 6 servers total to choose from, and usually only one of those two is close to being full I've found.

The sound design is horrible. You don't hear gunshots unless you're RIGHT UP NEXT TO THE PERSON THAT'S SHOOTING. The only time you ever hear a gun being shot at you is a slight whiff" when bullets are close to you that's very quiet. In fact
date: a lot of the sounds are very quiet or nonexistent. Footsteps
recommended:
damage sounds; the sound design in general just doesn't seem very well contrived at all.

Verdict:

At this point in time I can't in good conscience recommend the game. It's FUN
hoursPlayed: but rather empty and home to some pretty annoying design choices. Particularly regarding sound. 5/10"
